Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Jenirose
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mascagni was excellent [room, staff, location, and breakfast....wi-fi was a PITA they would only give it in 2 hour increments not that we were there for the wi-fi but we needed to check bills, and banking, map places out etc].

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, first class, would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Mand90
Reviews.Content: Location: Excellent, it is literally a 10 minute walk (with luggage) from the train station. The metro is 2 minutes away (we used that to get to the Vatican and walked from there via various sights back to the hotel). The rest of the sights including the Colossum were all in walking distance. Room: Excellent, we booked a twin and they upgraded us for free to a twin suite. The shower was awsome, just what you needed to get you started for a long day of walking. The room was clean and everything we needed was there. We couldn't get on the internet but didn't worry too much as we were far too busy sightseeing. The bed was a little hard but nothing like the one we slept in at the last hotel we stayed at, no springs in the back this time. There was extra pillows and blankets if you needed them. Breakfast: Excellent, plenty of choice, lots of it and really good quality. The waiters were very polite and helpful. All the staff were very helpful (especially the gentleman on reception in the mornings) and their English was very good. Nothing was too much trouble. I have been to Rome before with my husband and wish we had stayed at this hotel. This time I took my daughter for her 21st birthday. We had a wonderful time. There are still things I haven't seen in Rome and I will be booking this hotel again. Excellent, first class.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good People, Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: pauljames403
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through my travel agent who gave me three choices and after considering reviews on TA as well as other factors we went with the Mascagni. First trip to Rome so had no idea on the area or anything else and we were pleasently surprised on many fronts. First, the hotel itself was very nice. extremely well kept, clean, and everything worked. The staff was excellent. Very friendly and attentive. The front desk gave us several dinner recomendations and while I know it is common for this to be an arraingment between the two businesses rather than an actual great place, that is up to you to visit the recommended restaurent, check it out, have a look at the menu etc. We found two great places through the hotel, and several on our own. The Hotel has a bar just off the front desk that opens at 5. Nice little place with a great bartender. Expensive, as are drinks anywhere in Rome. (except wine) Vodka cocktail was 12 euro, (about 15 bucks) Although I had a few there, I also went round the corner and bought a whole bottle for about the same price as one drink. The room we had was on the second floor and was a "standard room", they do have an upgrade which was a little bigger. Our room was fine and actually was one of only three or four that have a small balconey, which we found great. Bed was a little hard, TV was pretty limited for english, and the shower was extremly small. Basically a tub/shower, but short and very narrow. You are definetly showering solo here :) --- Must say however, very clean, good water presure and hot!! Found the location to be very good. About a 15 minute walk from Termini station, the main train station, a Metro stop a block away, buses, taxi very plentiful. Also found the area very busy and safe both during the day and during the evening. We were out as late as 10 or so after dinner and found no issue at all with the people out and about. The actual Termini Station area, as I said about 15 minute walk away was a little sketchier.....the area around the hotel was fine, in fact 2 very high end hotels, St Regis Grand, and The Bernini are within a block. Many restaurents within a 10 minute walk in any direction and we walked to many major attractions. Trevi Fountain was about 15 minutes, and we walked to the Colosseum which was about 35-40 minutes but worth it because we saw so much along the way. You can take the Metro back. There is a Metro Station accross from the Colosseum, and one a block from the hotel. Would highly recommend this hotel based on comfort, value, staff, and location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in beautiful Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Swee_Swee_23
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend were booked in for 4 nights here at the Hotel Mascagni. The hotel was booked through Travel Republic and was sorted however there seemed a slight miscommunication somewhere. We went to check into the hotel of our 1st day and were told unfortunately there had been a mix up in our booking between Travel Republic, the agents and the hotel and they were expecting us the following day. Right, not a great start. In all fairness I don’t think this was any fault of the hotel and I have contacted Travel Republic requesting an explanation for the situation. The gentleman at reception was very apologetic and explained how this was going to be resolved. The hotel had arranged for a one night stay at the Hotel Victoria. The hotel arranged for a taxi to take us their immediately, a contact name and number for who we needed to speak to at Hotel Victoria and explained that the next day we should leave our bags with Hotel Victoria and by the afternoon when we were to return to the Mascagni, our room would be ready with our bags already there. And true to their word the next day everything was sorted and they went out of their way to thank us for being understanding and gave us a complimentary bowl of fruit, a large bottle of wine and a lovely room at the back of the hotel which was pleasantly quiet. So I would not let this blip effect my overall perception of the hotel. The members of staff were friendly and polite. The room spacious, clean and smartly decorated, the bed very comfy and wooden shutters and heavy curtains meant no cracks of light in the early hours of the morning (so make sure an alarm is set if you need to get up early!) The bathroom was clean and spacious, good shower and the towels changed every day. The breakfast selection was tasty and nicely presented; don’t expect to have a big fry up -there was scrambled egg and some small sausages but plenty of fruit, breads, pastries, fresh juices, cereal, jams etc. The Mascagni is a perfect location, right near the metro termini station – I would advise anybody to get the airport shuttle bus, this drops you right at the metro termini station and if you stay here at the Mascagni you can walk to the hotel no problem meaning you save loads by avoiding getting a taxi to and from the airport. The hotel is the perfect spot for walking to the Trevi fountain, a main road of shops, restaurants, the Pantheon, and other attractions. A short trip on the very easy metro for a euro at a time or 4 euro for a day ticket gets you to the Colosseum & the Vatican City in no time. There are only 2 lines on the Rome Underground so much easier than our London Underground so definitely use it you need too! Overall, me and my boyfriend had a wonderful time in Rome, it’s a beautiful place, the Hotel Mascagni was lovely and I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Internet Policy”
Reviews.Author: oneton60
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms although somewhat small to be a triple. Main problem was that wi-fi was doled out in 1-2 hr intervals. Had to constantly ask for new password. Very inconvenient. Breakfast good. Street rather noisy at night but would probably stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful internet, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Joe R
Reviews.Content: I need the internet. The internet service here was terrible. I can't stay in a hotel without access to the internet. This ruined a stay which would otherwise have been reasonable. Before I keep ranting on about the internet - the room was very nice. We were upgraded on check in to a 'superior' room which had a larger area and a balcony - lovely! The room was spacious, very clean and the bed comfortable. Breakfast was adequate. Not quite the range that I've had before in similarly priced hotels in Rome. Ok so back to the internet. For a start the wifi connection did not reach into the room so one had to go downstairs to the bar area or sit outside in an 'internet zone' in order to connect. Connecting problems aside the issue then became trying to load anything. Good luck with that. In fairness to the reception, they were sympathetic and one did try and restart the router to get it moving again but this was only a temporary boost. So overall - perfectly adequate. Near to the main train station and easy enough access to sites. But, there is better at this price level in Rome. If you want to isolate yourself from the world - stay here. If you need to get your fix online then stay away.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Elisabeth57
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on the location (our friends were staying across the street at the St. Regis) and the price. We couldn't have been more delighted by the experience. The hotel staff was professional, warm, helpful and always accomodating. The room was well appointed, clean and comfortable, if a bit small. But as in most major cities, hotel rooms are typically tight in space. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet, as well as the ease of access to the city. We would HIGHLY RECOMMEND this hotel to anyone traveling to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for much more”
Reviews.Author: bill p
Reviews.Content: We spent much of the week commenting on how happy we were with this hotel. Newly redone from top to bottom, the hotel is exceptionally clean and welcoming. The staff was very helpful -- especially the breakfast waitstaff who went out of their way each morning to make each meal special for our children (thank you Marco). The location is great and the rooms are nicely done. The wifi situation is a little spotty, except at the bar -- so that works too. Would stay here again if we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality”
Reviews.Author: crusader9872
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the best hotels i have ever had the pleasure to stay in. Everything about our stay was spot on from the location to the room the staff in particular were most helpful from giving directions to booking restaurants and just being very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, great local, exceptional staff.”
Reviews.Author: vivscotlady
Reviews.Content: Super hotel, we booked a superior room which was lovely, very clean and well maintained. If you are considering booking this hotel, mail them beforehand and ask for a balcony room, as there are few of them but it makes all the difference. The room keeping was superb and unobtrusive, and everyone of the desk and the waiting staff very helpful and courtious. Would recommend, and will be back :D

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: New-Nell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Rome to celebrate a special birthday. Our estate agent found this great little hotel as he knows we like small, friendly hotels in a good location. The Mascagni fills the bill exactly. The reception staff went out of their way to be helpful, recommending cafes and restaurants, booking for us if necessary and getting us taxis. They entered into the conspiracy of obtaining surprise birthday flowers and delivering them to the room. After which I returned to the room to discover a complementary bottle of Prosecco. As they booked that night's restaurant (Restaurant Giglio just 10 minutes walk away) for us I even got a birthday dessert adorned with a candle! They made my birthday really special. Now that is going the extra mile! Thank you so much As for the rest of our stay .... the whole hotel was clean and well cared for. Clean sheets every day. The breakfast room was well appointed with attentive staff and plenty of choice. If I have any adverse comment it is that I looked particularly to see if the rooms had tea and coffee making and it was not mentioned. I was of course delighted to find that it did but I would have taken my own tea bags from home if I'd known. Now I feel mean for even mentioning that. The location is ideal as we walked everywhere apart from to the Vatican. The station and metro are a short walk away should you want them, as is the hop on/off bus stop. I would return to this hotel and recommend it to friends. Mind you I'm tempted to keep my secret!

Reviews.Title: “Great return trip”
Reviews.Author: RosesSavannah
Reviews.Content: Ten years ago we stayed at the Mascagni. Returning with friends we found a friendly staff, renovated rooms, a pleasant cocktail bar, great breakfast and again a forgotten excellent location. Near many interesting sites, we had dinner twice at the Ristorante La Pentolaccia, via Flavia. Other great meals at the Ristorante Il Chianti, Via del Lavatore, Fontana di Trevi and the Ristorante Al Presidente, Via in Arcione. Quiet, air-conditioned in the hottest September on record, and totally accomodating. Recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Alan_and_Moya
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights and can't say a bad word against it. Staff are friendly and very helpful. Quick to point you in the right direction for what ever it may be. The beds are by far the most comfortable I have ever slept in apart from my own at home. My only problem was that the internet was extremely slow and someone or thing was trying to attack my computer with a dns cache poisoning attack, according to my internet security software. The rooms are not large but they are clean and have tea and coffee makings. A big plus for my wife and I. The hotel is close to the underground and main rail station as well as the hop on hop off bus stop. If we ever come back to Rome this is the place we will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: ycodina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mascagni Hotel during Christmas. The hotel service has great. The Gentleman at the front desk were both very helpful. The breakfast had a great variety and it was very good. The rooms were clean and the bathrooms were large. They provide you with a code in order to use one of their computer stations. The location was great, since it is just steps to the Metro station and the buses also pass near the station. I will greatly recommend this hotel. We are planning to go back in June and we are planning to stay at the Mascagni again.

Reviews.Title: “Gem”
Reviews.Author: jerseyal186230
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel from mon 30th 2012 for 4 nights....we had a room on the 4th floor.as it was a special occasion the hotel presented us with a bottle of pink bubbly. i would highly recommend this hotel...the room was spotless and clean..breakfast was good with a variety of choices,,,staff very friendly and attentive....very close to the train station and tube.rooms are soundproofed no noise from adjacent rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Small cosy and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Penonboy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Mascagni in January and it lived up to our expectations gained from reading other reviews on this site. The hotel web site gives an accurate description and our room was like the one shown in the photographs. We booked a taxi from the airport online before we left and it cost 40 euro, worth it to be driven directly to the hotel in around 40 minutes. We booked a superior room, which although not large was adequate and tastefully decorated. We requested a quiet room and were given one on the fourth floor, with a balcony at the back of the hotel overlooking a church. We slept well and were not disturbed by noise. The heating in the room can be controlled, so although the hotel was very warm we could turn the heating down in our room. We had a courtesy tray for tea and coffee and the slippers, robes and fluffy towels were welcome. The room was comfortable, kept very clean and linen was changed daily. The shower was powerful and the water hot. Although WIFI was free it was not possible to connect in the room and we had to go into the lobby area. The breakfast room is charming and the breakfast staff friendly and attentive. Breakfast suited our needs very well. Each day we had fruit and yogurt followed by scrambled eggs and toast or pastry. (If you expect full english you will be disappointed.) The hotel is located opposite the expensive Grand Regis hotel in quite a nice neighbourhood. On the first night we walked 15 mins to the Trevi fountain. The walk to the Roman Forum is about 25 mins or 2 stops on the metro which is a few minutes walk from the hotel. It is a long walk to the Vatican but we enjoyed it. We had to take a taxi back from the Vatican due to a public transport strike and it cost 20 euro. We booked a tour of the Colosseum and the Vatican with Angel tours and can highly recommend them, our guide Lindy, was superb and really brought things to life. On the first night the hotel recommended Target restaurant behind the hotel, we found it disappointing and did not go there again. We liked La Fontanella Sistina near the Piazza Barbarina, 5 mins walk, which is simple, served good fresh food at a reasonable price. We also ate well at Monti near the termini station. We would stay at this hotel again as we prefer small intimate hotels which have some character and this represents value for money.

Reviews.Title: “excellent friendly service”
Reviews.Author: tom m
Reviews.Content: This place exceeded our expectations! My wife and I traveled to Rome for her 60th birthday. A friend (who lives in Rome) dropped off a couple bottles and a fruit basket for us. He must of made a great impression 'cause they upgraded us to a lovely room with a balcony on the 4th floor. The room was kept immaculate. The concierge, the servers and the busboy could not have been better! The view off our balcony was an 18th century church and piazza. The king size bed was firm and comfortable. We asked for reccomendations to restaurants in walking distance and they were great. They arranged for a airport taxi to pick us up at 6:30 am. He was there waiting when we came downstairs. They even packed us a box breakfast to take to the airport! We had traveled to Venice before we went to Rome and stayed at a 5 star (Daneli) hotel there. This was overall a better hotel experience than the Daneli which cost 3x as much.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: mogers
Reviews.Content: Spent 8 nights here at the end of November.   Great location, very helpful staff.  Our  room may have been one of the best they have,  on the 4th floor with a small balcony on the quiet side of the building.  After moving  on to Florence and Venice, we can look back and say that the Mascagni's included breakfast was the best, the only one with some hot food choices.  The room size may be a bit small but very adequate, and easily the most comfortable bed we've had on this trip.  The only improvement they could make would be to add better wifi distribution to get a usable signal strength in the rooms, otherwise you may need to sit in the hallway on your floor, that does have chairs and a table, or go down to the very nice lobby bar area for a strong signal.   We had them arrange a private car pickup from the airport, which was a worthwhile expense after a long flight from the US.  The train station is an easy walk, but you'll want to use a taxi if you're going with luggage.  There is a Metro "A" line stop, and many bus stops right down the street.  If you're looking for a store to get SIM cards for a phone or iPad, ask the hotel, there is an electronics store nearby that understood exactly what I needed.  Plenty of good restaurants nearby, or places to get simple food to bring back to your room.  Another comparison to our stops in Florence and Venice, is that  Rome easily has the most "reliable" food choices, meaning most anyplace you drop in to, is going to be very good to excellent any time of day.  Florence was nearly as good, while Venice has been very hit or mostly miss. One final tip,  late November is a fantastic time to visit, there have been no tourist crowds, no lines at the major attractions, and all the hotels we considered discount their rates for the off season.  Weather, at least this year (2011) has been very pleasant.  We would definitely book the Mascagni again if we find ourselves coming back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Average For The Rate”
Reviews.Author: Journeyboomers
Reviews.Content: Had a 3 night stay. Check in good. Room quite compact but was subjected to renovation building noise from adjacent building until after 9.30 PM. We did get a room change the next day, but would have been nice on the day when I first raised my concern but apparently the hotel was full! The concierge also made the point the room was an upgraded one :) Our room did get bathroom noises from those above us and the Wi Fi was unreliable. Breakfast was fine with a reasonable selection. Hint to find the hotel from the station head straight down the road through the taxi rank avoiding the usual gaggle of Gysies, hawkers etc, proceed past roundabout fountain and hotel is on right side of street. It's about 500 metres from the station. If you're catching the train to the airport platform 26 is another 300m so be prepared. Also you will be hassled on the train too, so be aware. You can buy a ticket from the station Tabac and remember to validate it.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: maam41
Reviews.Content: Although some of the rooms are a little on the small side I thoroughly enjoyed this hotel. The hotel itself was gorgeous, clean with amazing customer service and wonderful breakfast. I loved this hotel's position, which is close by to some amazing eateries and the tour office. Try the pasticceria and gelato shop close by which is amazing!!! I will definitely stay here on my next trip to Italy!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, good location. Adequate hotel, not 4 star quality.”
Reviews.Author: Femke V
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpfull staff, metrostop Republica around the corner (3 minutes walk), Termini station very close (10 minutes walk or 1 metrostop), Via Nazionale with shops on the next street, old center of Rome 15/20 minutes walk. Very central location. Bedroom area was nicely decorated, small, but adequate. With coffee/tea facilities and small safe for your valuables. Good beds. Quiet room on fifth floor. Bathroom amenities adequate: soap, shampoo, bathfoam, showercap (you needed it) and shoesponge (who ever uses it?). Overall: the hotel is not 4 star quality, 3+ at best. Expensive for what you get, even in Rome. Breakfast was adequate not good. White rolls and toast (no whole grane), sweet cakes, rather old fruit, only pork and cheese for cold cuts, different jams/marmelades. Scrambled eggs and hot dog sausages. Everyday the same thing, no variation. The room unfortunately was not cleaned very well, it was never vacuumed in the days we stayed there (I could tell), even though we tipped the maid 5 euros the first day. The bathroom was very, very plain and not clean either. It had black mold on the walls, the toilet had big yellow stripes in the bowl and it looked smudgy. The shower was fixed in the wall and was very calcified so we got our own Trevi fountain in the bathroom when we showered. That was...interesting. TV in the room only had three non-italian channels (CNN, BBC worldnews and SAT 1 (Austria), often with bad reception. You expect better in a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Teganyssa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Mascagni for 6 nights with 3 of us sharing. The room was spacious, well appointed and very quiet. There was a good choice for breakfast and the staff seemed to remember our special orders which was a nice touch. The location was excellent, we walked most places and it was only a few minutes to the train station when we wanted to go further afield. The staff were helpful with directions and with recommendations to local restaurants and when our wallet got stolen they were great with supplying the info we needed to sort this out. There was wireless internet in the bar and in the common area on our floor - where they had provided both seats and a table for guests to use while logging on. Would I stay there again - yes!

Reviews.Title: “Just the job for our long weekend break, excellent!”
Reviews.Author: APM_Lazlo
Reviews.Content: Having looked for a reasonably priced hotel in Rome and checked the trip advisor feedback we had no hesitation in booking the Mascagni. We weren’t let down, excellent B&B hotel! The air conditioning is the best I’ve ever experienced, beds firm but comfortable, staff couldn’t be more helpful and courteous, especially at check in. The bar on the ground floor is small but the bar staff were very sociable, the breakfast waiters and waitress were also very friendly. Whilst the breakfast area itself is a bit small for the size of hotel it was comfortable and the food was very good. Situated near the Termini station and the nearest metro of Republicca we found it in an ideal location to explore Rome. Big thumbs up from our family for the Mascagni! On arrival at the airport quite late at night we headed for the station however we opted to catch a minibus instead, at a cost of 70 euros for four of us (compared to 56 euros for the train) we got to experience a Rome taxi driver at first hand, interesting! We also picked up the Roma pass, definitely a must to get you into two sites and to cover the Metro. As others have said you can pretty much walk anywhere from the Hotel. We visited in August, it was hot in the late 30’s. Our tactics were to get up at a reasonable time for breakfast and walk down to the chosen sight of the day. By lunchtime we were ready for a bite to eat so invariably found a good restaurant in the area we had visited (Piazza Navona and the square by the Pantheon being our favourites) then catch the bus back up to Republicca. We’d then spend 2-3 hours in the hotel room cooling down before opting to go out again for the late afternoon and evening. Favourite restaurants, Ristorante Esperia on via Firenze off Via Nazionale (heading down from Republicca it’s on your left), Trattoria Al Pantheon in the square. All in all a fantastic long weekend from Fri to Tues. On the last day we did the 110open bus ride and realised it was a mistake to leave it to the end. With the option to get on and get off at selected stops we should have used it earlier especially as the 50 euro ticket for a family of four (2 adults and 2 under 18s) lasted for two days. Finally as I’m sure you would want to, you can’t miss the Vatican, but do as my wife did and book your tickets on-line in advance to avoid the queues, it was very busy, use the metro to get there and get off at Ottaviano. When it came time to leave we asked at reception about a Taxi and they secured one for 55 euros, 4 people and three medium holdalls, gave us a relaxed ride in a Merc to the airport, better than a train journey I’d say.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kimballdc2
Reviews.Content: After endless research online we booked our stay at the Hotel Mascagni. My partner and I stayed at the hotel for 7 days. Right from the start the hotel staff was very accomodating. We arrived in Rome on a early morning flight, they gave us a room right away even though check-in was not until 3pm. The staff were always very welcoming, everyone had a smile, and we were made to feel very special. The room was very clean and comfortable and a good size for a european hotel. The bathrooms where a little small but not the smallest I have seen. The complimentary breakfast was great. The food was tasty and it saved us a lot of money. The waiters so very friendly, helpful and attentive. The hotel was close to the train station, and is walking distance of all the main sights, we walked everywhere we went while in Rome which is was a great way to see Rome. the only down side to the hotel was the extremely slow internet. Other than that we really enjoyed our time at the Hotel Mascagni.

Reviews.Title: “would definately stay again”
Reviews.Author: 460Aussietraveller11
Reviews.Content: An old hotel but a real gem. The rooms are small but spacious and very clean and comfortable. The staff are friendly and obliging, you get the feeling that nothing would be too much trouble. Breakfast is included and very tasty. Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “We fell in love with Hotel Mascagni”
Reviews.Author: Artemis_K_87
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Mascagni for two days (17/12-19/12/2010).Actually the first day we arrived late at night but after the trouble we had during our flight, arriving at the hotel was trully refreshing!They welcomed us an made us feel really comfortable. We had room 303 and it was trully amazing!Although we were tired after our trip, when we went inside the room we were speechless.It was spacious, beautifully decorate with tall ceiling (I mean really tall) and very warm!The bathroom was great too and had it's own radiator.The view wasn't great it was at the back of the hotel but to tell you the truth we didn't mind as it was more quiet. The breakfast had variety and the staff was really helpfull! The location of the hotel was great!It was within walking distance from most of the major sights.We never used the bus or the metro except of the day we went to the Vatican. When we left I felt really sad not only because we were leaving from Rome but because we were leaving from Hotel Mascagni. So I decided to visit Rome again this November but this time alone and I booked a room once again at the Hotel Mascagni from their site!I can't wait to visit Rome and my favorite hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: tomsak
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here in August. We stayed in a "family room" which amounts to a king bed and two twins which are part of a pull out sofa (but very comfortable for 2 teenagers). Great location near the Republica Metro station and close to the Termini RR station. Good walkable location to most attractions with the Vatican a short 20 minute Metro ride away. The rooms are very tastefully appointed. A/C worked fine. Bathroom was large. Very clean and quiet room. There are 6 floors plus the main floor, approx. 6-8 rooms per floor. We had a high floor (6th) facing the rear so noise was not a problem. I would imagine that a 2nd floor room facing the street would be a bit noisy but the windows seemed to have very good insulation. Breakfast was very good, not a large buffet type but perfectly adequate for the scale of the hotel. Staff was very accomodating at all times. There is a small lounge and bar area on the first floor but the is not the type of hotel where one would be looking to hang out in the lounge other than for quiet relaxation. Do not attempt to bring your own glass of wine as this is a no go. Also, as consistent with smaller hotels in Europe, there is one small elevator. Patience required or get your exercise. In any event, it is a very nice change of pace from your larger scale hotels. Internet Wi-Fi works well in the lobby and each floor lounge area but takes a little doing to adjust your settings on a PC. Macs are available for public use in the Internet lounge. The front desk staff is very accommodating, speak good English, and are very helpful and knowledgable. A very nice and appreciated touch was a breakfast "go box" on check out since we left at 6am for the airport. Luciano at the front desk is tremendous, very professional and a real gentleman. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to any class of traveler. PS - In classic small hotel European manner, one leaves their key at the front desk when leaving the hotel and picks it up upon returning. Given this routine practice, it is absolutely incredulous that any of the staff would ever enter a room to steal anything, let alone a passport as reported in prior review.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great spot, and DELICIOUS breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: jerseymainie
Reviews.Content: Great all-round hotel. It's right near the metro for the Piazza della Repubblica and it's also very close to the Roma Termini. We took a cab from the Termini because there was construction outside of the main gate and we had big bags. Otherwise, you could walk it if you're traveling lightly. The rooms were lovely with very clean beds and bathrooms. The rooms were also very quiet even though we faced the street. Three of us had one room with 3 single beds and it was still very spacious and comfortable. The ambiance was traditional in the rooms, but very fun and modern in the main areas. I thought it was a nice mix and a cool atmosphere. And the best part of it all was the fabulous breakfast buffet. There were freshly cooked eggs and meats, cereals, yogurts, and fresh fruit. The coffee was great since it's not so easy to find a good cup on the street in that area. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: e_and_r_57
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few days a the end of our Honeymoon here and found it a great place to stay. Rooms very nice and close to central train station as well as local metro station. Make sure you ask them for resturaunt recomendation as the two they gave us were some of the best on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “A flawless experience, a real treat to stay here and be looked after”
Reviews.Author: happytapeworm
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews on TripAdvisor I opted for a stay in Mascagni to celebrate my partners birthday and visit Rome for the first time. It was a really special experience, a great hotel in an amazing city. The staff are amongst the most helpful I have ever come across on my travels, the hotel it immaculate, the rooms are well appointed and having upgraded to a deluxe room we were at the back of the hotel away from the road, had a balcony and a view of some amazing architecture. Breakfast was a self-service buffet and despite it's compact proportions the breakfast room never felt overcrowded. Staff were quick to clear tables and seemed happy to help with the whims of all guest, even some strange requests for things like kiwi and sausage. The hotel is situated in a good location for catching tour buses, is within walking distance of most of the major sites (and the railway station). It is also close to a number of fantastic restaurants, ask the receptionist to help you out here, not only will they book for you but you'll be treated like royalty when you get to your chosen venue. All in all a fantastic stay and somewhere I hope to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: gamalMD
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 days and everything about this hotel was perfect. It is centrally located with many of the main tourist attractions within walking distance. Room was small but very clean with great bathroom. The front office people were very friendly, welcoming and professional. Wonderful breafast.

Reviews.Title: “Stole one of our passports, and called me fat: A saga of the worst hotel I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: thefunnygirl
Reviews.Content: I would like to say that I am telling this story in all truth – everything I shall write is something that actually happened, without exaggeration. I will try to explain everything with fact and without emotion, because my experience was so utterly horrifying and strange that it should not require emotional emphasis. I checked in to the Hotel Mascagni with my two friends E and K (both women my age). The man behind the front desk (Luciano – I will never forget his name – Luciano) checked us in – this included photocopying our passports - and we went to our room. My friend K immediately put her things (wallet, checkbook, passport) into the room safe because she had them on hand. My friend E and I took a moment to take off our shoes, etc. When we went to open the safe, however, it would not open, even with the code. We called down to the lobby for help, and Luciano said he would send “the boy” up (“the boy” was the bellhop Giuseppe) to fix it. No one came for some time, so we decided to hide our passports in a drawer under some papers because we hadn’t eaten all day and we were starving. We went out for a quick bite and walked around, returning two hours later. When we returned, Giuseppe followed us up and opened the safe. K’s items were still there. However, when we went to get the two other hidden passports out of the drawer to put in the safe, my friend E’s was missing. We searched the entire room before realizing that it was officially gone. Just hers, mind you – mine and K’s were still there. E called her parents, both seasoned attorneys, and they advised her to call the police and file a report. We went downstairs to talk to Luciano, telling him the passport was missing. “That is impossible! You have clearly just lost it. Look again.” (He sent Giuseppe up with us – he lifted up beds that we had already checked under, moved furniture we had already checked behind, and when we asked what to do next, he just shook his head and left the room.) We went back downstairs and asked Luciano to call the police. He tried repeatedly to deter us from this. He wasn’t the best English speaker, so E tried to get him on the phone with her father, who speaks Italian rather well. He refused. Finally, he called the police. NOTE: It is important at this point to note that while my friend E and I do not speak Italian incredibly well, we understand it well. So we understood everything he said while speaking in Italian on the phone. While on the phone with the police, he did not report the passport as stolen. Rather, he said that “three little girls” had “lost” one of their passports. I can understand not wanting a police report with your hotel on file, but he essentially called the police and told them to not come because we were being “silly.” He said, “She tried to put me on the phone with her father, how ridiculous is that? What would that do?” He repeatedly got the facts wrong, and although we corrected him many times, he didn’t seem to care about the actual details of the story. Here’s a gem from this phone conversation: “We are like a family here, we would never steal. I can understand if it was a ring, or a hundred bucks, but a passport? And just one passport?” (So, just to be clear, you would never steal unless it was money or jewelry. Classy.) He hung up and told us that a police officer couldn’t come “because no force had been used.” To this day, I am not aware if this is an actual thing in Rome. But I’m fairly certain that the fact that he had not actually reported the crime that had occurred is why they didn’t come. He then started talking to someone else on the phone, presumably the manager of the hotel. Still unaware that we understood everything he was saying, he said, in Italian, “I’ve got the little one and the fat one here.” Now, I am overweight. But he is apparently in the industry of hospitality, and even normal human beings know not to call people fat right in front of them. That was it for me – I immediately got onto the INCREDIBLY slow Internet and started finding a new hotel. He had burned this bridge. At this point, it didn’t matter if the passport did turn up; I wasn’t spending another second there. I called the company I had booked with, and immediately demanded a refund. They promptly called the hotel, and Luciano proceeded to tell them the story that we “little girls” had “lost” the passport, and we were just being silly. My friend asked for the copy of her passport he had taken, and when he handed it to her, he said condescendingly, “Here you go, try not to lose it!” We went upstairs and packed our bags. As we got in a cab to go to another hotel, we turned to Luciano. “By the way, you should know that we understand Italian. And I heard you call me fat.” I said this loudly enough so everyone in the hotel lobby could hear. Very movie-moment. He denied it. He vehemently denied it. But then, as we put our things in the taxi, he came outside again and said, “Well, anyway, you are the more bigger one!” and scampered back inside. Without my friend’s passport, we had to beg a hotel to accept the photocopy so she could stay with us. We ended up staying in an incredible hotel (the Hotel Splendide Royal), which cost more, but was worth it because they salvaged the rest of our stay in Rome. The passport never turned up, as far as we know. They took down our contact information, but never “got back to us.” They still got away with charging us one night’s stay because of the cancellation fee. It also took them days to contact the booking company back to authorize our refund (as, I suppose, a final “screw you”). I ended up spending a lot of money to try and fix this disaster. This was, without a doubt, the WORST hotel I have ever stayed in. Look, if you really want to stay here – like, if your life depends on it - go ahead. But with a thousand other hotels in Rome where a passport has never been taken, and a guest has never been verbally abused, why would you?

Reviews.Title: “We liked Hotel Mascagni.”
Reviews.Author: Retro92
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its proximity to Rome Termini, the main train station in Rome. We travelled by train from Florence and after our stay to the airport, and we found it was a relatively easy transfer from station to hotel, even with our loads of luggage. It also means the hotel is a fair distance from many of the attractions in Rome. This problem is solved by its prximiity to the Republicca Metro station. Or, you can use your feet, which is what we did mostly. But that meant a lot of walking. The hotel staff were friendly and excellent english speakers. They showed great personal commitment to the hotel - as an example, some of the breakfast fruits came from a staff members own garden (yum!). Breakfast was not gourmet but good enough. We found the rooms clean and everything worked, although the a/c was a little patchy in one of the rooms. One small improvement that could be made is providing two room keys - we were only allowed one per room, which meant that because of the way the interconnecting rooms worked, we could not ensure access to our young children in the adjoining room whilst keeping their a/c on at the same time (bear in mind we were there at the height of the Rome summer - 36 degrees!). Not a major problem, but something we noticed that coudl be simply impoved.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: TerandAnd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. This was our first trip to Rome and the hotel was well located. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and the accommodation clean, well maintained and of a high standard. The main train terminal into Rome is within walking distance and can therefore be used to travel to and from the airport and for those that don"t want to walk everywhere there is a underground station about 100 metres from the hotel. The underground is one of the easiest to use that we have come across. Tips for Rome - trips around the main attractions are best done with a tour guide but make sure you choose a good firm; we would suggest thinking twice before using SP.Q.R who failed to deliver their promises on the Vatican tour. It is worth having an evening meal in the Piazza Navonna whilst watching the world go by but be warned it is expensive and the restaurants add on a service charge! We recommend a restaurant called 'Est, est, est' in Via Genova, reputed to be one of the oldest pizzerias and was very good and inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “lovely small hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: whocindylou
Reviews.Content: I am reposting this review that I made anonymously years ago. We spent our first five nights in Italy (2/14/03 - 2/19/03) at the Hotel Mascagni. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this fine little hotel. The staff were all very friendly, helpful, professional, and knowledgeable. We had requested a quiet room on an upper floor and received just that. We were on the 6th floor overlooking the dome of a beautiful old church. Our room was small, but comfortable. We had a good bed and adequate storage for our things. The bathroom was immaculate and very well laid out. I really came to appreciate the steam radiator in the bathroom after the second day of walking! Every night I'd draw a steaming hot bath and soak for hours in the very cozy tub listening to the nice sizzle of that radiator (it was freezing temps at night) while I read up on whatever we were going to do the next day. I could have stayed indefinitely at the Mascagni. The complimentary breakfast was the exact same every day, but it was very nice. Eggs (runny one day, to hard the next), cereals, pastries, fresh fruits, good coffee, and juices). We met a variety of people from all over the world, which was very nice (very few Americans). Another bonus about staying at the Mascagni is that it is right around the corner from the Piazza Repubblica and the Metro station. We bought a one week pass and took buses and the metro all over the city, multiple times a day (the pass was $12.40 euros for the week, a bargain!). The station being so close allowed us to travel afar more spontaneously than we would have had it not been so convenient. The only negative was the smoking (and it is why this is a four star instead of five star review), which is a negative about the entire country of Italy evidently. When people in neighboring rooms smoked (and they all did), WE smoked. I have asthma and this really did put a damper on my stay. Evidently the ventilation system ties all of the rooms together even though there are individual thermostats in the rooms. That said, we would definitely stay at the Mascagni when we return to Rome. Oh, and did I mention that their off-season rates combined with a pay 4-night, stay 5th night free package made the room an amazing deal (about $500 euros for the five nights including breakfast and taxes)???

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Jeannie07
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely wonderful. Beautiful rooms with beautiful bathrooms and very clean. Small but typical for european hotels. Great morning breakfast in a lovely dining room with a wide selection of items. Intimate bar with a very accommodating bartender. We had a complimentary bottle of wine on check in (coupon off of trip advisor) which we chose to have in the bar instead of our room. It was a great start to our trip. Walking distance to train station and metro making it a very convenient location to stay. The front desk was very accommodating. They called and made reservations at several restaurants for us and their recommendations were excellent. The only odd thing that happened during our stay was we asked for an iron on a Sunday and were told that since it was Sunday they couldn't give us an iron to use. Not sure why but maybe the reason was lost in the translation??? I would absolutely stay here again and think this hotel should be rated much higher than it appears on trip advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Well kept property; central location.”
Reviews.Author: ConsumersPhl
Reviews.Content: Very nice choice. The property is well kept and the staff is professional. The rooms are small in sq ft, but the ceilings are high, perhaps 11 ft so you don't notice. We had a high floor overlooking the square to the rear, lovely view and pretty quiet. Everything worked. A bit expensive (at 300E / $450/night) but not out of line for better properties in a large city.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: MissCandDrS
Reviews.Content: We cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Upon arrival, we had a very warm welcome by Luciano, who promptly checked us in, then gave a map and some ideas of things to see and do during our trip. He also recommended a lovely restaurant nearby for our first evening. The rooms were clean, with a firm yet comfortable bed which was changed daily. We were in room 605 on the top floor, so it was very quiet, with little disruption from street noise below. The bathroom was large with a great shower and plenty of hot water. The only downside was the hairdryer in the bathroom, so if you do need a bit of power to style your hair – bring your own! Also if you are going to need to iron anything during your stay, there is no iron in the room and they are unable to provide one – you have to go into the corridor to iron things as there are no easily accessible power points in the room. A very minor thing. Location wise, this hotel is really close to the Metro station (a 2 minute walk) and we walked to the Colosseum in about 20 minutes. A taxi from the Airport was more expensive than expected and cost us 55 euro, so we got the train back, which took the same length of time (30 minutes) and was 28 euro. The main train station is easily accessible from the hotel – 1 stop on the metro and you are there (although you could walk, but it would be difficult crossing all the roads with baggage, so easier to use the metro as a bit of a subway.) Breakfast in the hotel is continental (pastries, bread, ham, cheeses, bread, yoghurt, fruit and cereal) with some hot food (eggs and bacon or sausage). It is self service, but the waiters are there to help and are lovely. They are more than willing to answer any questions and helped us with our daily plans with helpful suggestions and recommendations. Check out was speedy. Just remember in Rome there is a room tax of 3 euro per night which you have to pay on departure. The concierge was also able to order a taxi if required and they happily stored our bags for us free of charge, so we could make the most of our last morning. The staff really make this hotel and all of them are really welcoming and friendly. They also all speak fluent English, so although we went prepared with our Italian phrasebook, we didn’t need it in this hotel. A great stay and would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel with very friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: mcards
Reviews.Content: We ended up here unexpectedly due to our original hotel being double booked. Having researched our original choice for being close to a large choice of eating establishments as I have slight mobility problems, the Hotel Masagni wasn't to far away from some very nice restaurants The room we had was large and very quiet as it backed on to a church (no bells ringing) I took my laptop and was able to get free wifi in the room. There is a computer for customers to use next to breakfast room as well. The breakfast buffet was fine and the coffee very good. The metro is close by, bus stops outside, the train station not far, so we are very glad that we had the opportunity to stay here and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Parris
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights during Easter week this year. The hotel is close to the train station and across from the St. Regis Hotel. Our room was very nice with a city view. We walked to most sights from the hotel except for the Vatican area. My only complaint is the bed was very hard. They put two twins beds together which I also don't care for. Everything else at this lovely small hotel was nice. I enjoyed the breakfast that was included with our room and the service was great. The bartender would not give us our free drinks that we were given when we checked in for some reason. He said that we had to have them on the night we checked in. I don't think this is correct but I did not complain.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and comfortable hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: gregg2011
Reviews.Content: We had two doubles and one triple room for our group. This hotel has a very considerate staff. Location was a great location for walking to all sights of the city, but also easy access to metro, buses and train station. Very clean rooms with new sheets and towels every day even if you hang your towels. Breakfast was very good with excellent coffee (like mine black) and cappucino for the girls on request. Waiter staff very efficient and always repenishing the breakfast selections. Front desk staff were very helpful and booked some of our tour reservations on request. Would stay at this hotel on any future visit to Roma. They have two Apple computers with cable internet and I was given 48 hours of free internet on check in. There is a hotel bar with a nice casual lounger area.

Reviews.Title: “being for business , thinking of romantic ambience”
Reviews.Author: oliver_john63
Reviews.Content: A trip to Rome is, for many people, the trip of a lifetime . The problem is when one travels for business and not for pleasure. This hotel is located in the very center downtown, with the Via Veneto shopping district about half a mile aways, the perfetc combination for both; Built in a 19 th century palace with all modern comforts. it is not so big ( not more then 40) containing the personal touches only privately owned hotels can possess. The staff is very kind and polite, the ambience very romantic so even if I was in Rome for job, this hotel made me forget the reason I was for , making my staying in Rome more romantic

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: pinkswimmum
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mascagni for a short weekend. Room very comfortable, lots of hanging space. Nice bathroom. Room was very hot at night for these two northern Europeans, but we could sleep with the window open as we were on the sixth floor. Breakfast more than adequate. Special mention for all the staff, who were friendly and polite without exception. Especially Guiseppe at reception, who provided us with a couple of great recommendations for dinner, and gave us directions to the Roma store (even though he was a Lazio fan!)

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again anytime, all reviews are accurate.”
Reviews.Author: newsociety
Reviews.Content: The Good: City map provided the second you walk in. Rooms were very clean and a good size for Rome. Staff was polite and helpful. The included breakfast made things easy and was usually ready a little early. On the days we left early for tours the front desk would pack a breakfast free of charge and at their own suggestion. Wake up calls were computerized so very reliable. Almost everyone at this hotel speaks English. Housekeeping does a very good job of keeping the rooms clean. Safe in room held our important belongings undisturbed through out our stay. There is an ATM machine within 1/2 block up the street and a coffee shop next door and around the corner if you are up early. Location is awesome, walk to the Trevi is doable, subway is a short walk away. Pick up location for one of our hired tours was around the corner. We never paid a taxi once the whole week. Neighborhood seemed very safe and the Russian president was staying across the street so it must be pretty decent area. Recommend you hit the restaurant Target on the street behind the hotel. The bad: Bath tub very small (however shower head was high enough for a guy who is about 6' 3".) The rooms do get hot. We read this ahead of time and like warm rooms. They will cool down by opening the window but in Rome horns honk until about 2 am constantly. And the garbage man comes all hours of the night. Some of the front desk staff will seem annoyed with questions, but towards the end of the week I figured out that it's only because they are not sure what you want (due to translation and cultural differences). All that said I would stay here again anytime. The price was very reasonable for the location and the staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “The best!!”
Reviews.Author: drummerboy75
Reviews.Content: I researched a lot of hotels for our trip to Rome as it was a surprise for my girlfriend's birthday and chose the Mascagni based on location and price as well as other good reviews. On arrival we were greeted by Luciano who made check in very easy and got a map out to show where all the sites of interest were in relation to the hotel's location. He included useful bus numbers and metro stations to use as well as describing the services the hotel had to offer. We were upgraded to a superior room at no extra charge even though I booked a standard double as he felt that for a 5 night stay it was more appropriate. The room was spacious, very clean and beautifully decorated to a high standard with tea and coffee making facilities that were replenished without fail. The housekeeper did an excellent job every day and our room was always well presented. The hotel is perfectly located within walking distance of every major attraction and 50 meters away from a metro stop which will take you to the Vatican within minutes. It also happens to be across the road from an amazing Basilica which is worth popping into and the beautiful Piazza Della Republicca. It's within walking distance of the Termini Station. Francesco told us that as a bar tender he travels to competitions all over the world. He was friendly and each evening was ended with a good chat with him. He makes a mean Martini and great White Russian. On the day of my girlfriends birthday they presented her with a bottle of Italian champagne as a gift. What a lovely surprise and the perfect to round off the day. The breakfast is good, effective and very well presented with plenty of choice. The coffee is top drawer. Simply put, this hotel is amazing and the staff go out of their way to make it so. Thanks to Luciano, Francesco and the rest of the staff we had a very memorable time and when we go back we won't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Chafemilano
Reviews.Content: Stayed here December 2010 after seeing the other reviews and can only agree with the good things said - fantastic service, great location, lovely rooms and good value for money (deal with lastminute). 15 min walk to Trevi fountain, 3 minute walk to a metro station and 5 mins from Termini. Location also meant taxis back from the centre late at night were cheap. All concierge were very friendly, helpful and knowledgable. Would definitely recommend! Only drawback (v minor) is that the bed was a tad hard.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, but too hot!”
Reviews.Author: ScarySquirrel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mascagni Hotel for 4 nights in Rome with my girlfriend in November 2010. I am a 25 year old male, and my girlfriend is 24. I've broken the review down into a few key things. LOCATION The location was fantastic. It's about 5 minutes from Termini station, and only about 2 minutes from the Repubblica metro station (Metro only costs 1 Euro per journey!! BARGAIN!). We easily walked to all of the major sights (with the exception of the Vatican). It's a leisurely 15 mins to Trevi Fountain, 20-25 to the Pantheon, 30-35 to Piazza Navonna. These times are based on when we knew our way, when we were first looking for these places I would probably add another 5-10 minutes onto the above. Also bear in mind we were stopping and looking at things on the way. Everywhere you walk in Rome (at least where we walked) was lovely, so the walking time for us was no issue. ROOM The room was really nice, lovely bathroom, fairly spacious compared to others we looked at online. We only stayed in the standard room which meant there were no tea making facilities, which was a big problem as my girlfriend needs her tea! We asked a few times for hot water (she has her own decaf tea bags) and this seemed to caused huge issues, like it was a bit problem to ask for hot water. The room was also WAY TOO HOT!!! I can't describe how hot it was. It was either a choice between not being able to sleep with the window open because of the traffic noise from outside, or struggle to sleep because it was baking hot in the room. (Worth noting, there is practically no noise from the outside world with the windows closed). The cooling system in the room was about as useful as a chocolate teapot. The beds are very hard, which I am not used to, but it was actually quite comfortable. SERVICE Overall the service was very good, although as above, asking for hot water seemed an issue. One of the porters/concierge guys was a bit scary, and quite intimidating, but everyone else was great. When we arrived we were given a well rehearsed speech about where to go, and were given a map showing all of the main sight seeing locations. BREAKFAST Breakfast was good, as expected really. I just stuck to croissants and jam all week :) OVERALL I have pointed some negatives out above, but these are very minor, and overall the hotel is really nice, the location is great, and the price was good for us. We had a fantastic time and I would have no trouble recommending this hotel, so I have rated it 5 out of 5 despite the lower scores in some areas.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely welcoming”
Reviews.Author: CarolineET
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel online and would certainly recommend it. It was very conveniently situated and the staff were excellent - they couldn't do enough to help. Our room was on the third floor at the rear and therefore was quiet and so easy to sleep, it was also very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was very good although the first day they seemed to run a bit short of things but after that it was much better. All in all a good place to stay and we would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't want more from a small hotel in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Upstate51
Reviews.Content: The service (all, but particularly front desk) at the Mascagni was excellent. The rooms were lovely with ample closet space, nice bathrooms, and charming french doors that opened for an abundance of fresh air. Most importantly, the hotel provided an excellent nights sleep. Breakfast was more than we expected, and we found the location to be both convenient and slightly off the beaten path. I would hope to return to the Mascagni. Upstate New York

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ACVB1007
Reviews.Content: On our first trip to Rome we stayed at the Mascagni for four days. The front desk staff were great, very helpful and accommodating. They made restaurant suggestions that were within walking distance, we were not disappointed by any of the restaurants. We love to walk and they were very helpful in planning our routes to all major attractions. They even made many suggestions for other attractions that turned out to be wonderful surprises. We were there on my husband's birthday and they wished him a happy birthday and sent us up a bottle of Italian champagne to celebrate! The location is very good, 5 minute walk from Termini train station and buses and Metro right around the corner. Easy walk to Trevi fountain, Spanish Steps, shopping. Every staff person we encountered was very helpful and pleasant. The room was very clean, quiet at night, nicely decorated and good size. Breakfast was great. I would stay here again and recommend it to anyone traveling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: awaywegowithkids
Reviews.Content: We caught the red eye to Rome and arrived at the hotel around 0930 with 3 kids. The staff was fantastic they got our ajoining rooms ready in just a few minutes (it allowed everyone to take a much needed nap). The location was great, we literally walked everywhere without any problems and always enjoyed coming back to this hotel. We stayed in triples, the rooms were small, but exactly what I expect for a good location in a European city. We had good internet connections in the sitting area outside of the rooms . This is a great hotel and the staff is fantastic, don't hesitate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Can't put my finger on it???”
Reviews.Author: hairslisa
Reviews.Content: Hotel was small, Clean, dark rms, staff was excellent. Good breakfast but over crowed. Somewhat convenient if your a walker, noisier section/street in Rome. As for a 4 star rated hotel; I would say it was OK. Guess, I wouldn't say GREAT 4 star hotel because I feel it was overpriced (for what this travel paid- which was more than the beautiful 5 star hotel in Florence). not worth $$$$. Staff was excellent regardless of price. Oh! they start the demonstration every morning @ 9 am by the Hotel. Be prepared to hear a man on a megaphone. Keep the window closed for the noise from the traffic & demonstrator's. Yes, I did request a quite rm & was told upon arrival a quite rm was selected for us!?! Can say I would recommend this hotel or stay again but wouldn't say anything bad if one said they were staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, old school hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: golsonic
Reviews.Content: We chose the Mascagni for one night in Rome, and were very happy with the choice. It is in a great location, handy for Termini station, buses and with some good cafes and a great English bookshop very close. Traditional in style and decor, and the rooms are fairly small. We got "upgraded" to a room at the front, with a small balcony and a couch. Bathroom and amenities were great, fully up to four star standards. Robe and slippers a nice touch.Very friendly and helpful front desk, handing out maps and advice. Full hot and cold buffet breakfast. Only a one night stay, but really enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, small hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: jwoww
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel is excellent. Friendly and accommodating. It is a very small hotel, with small rooms, but they have recently been refurbished nicely. The location is very near the Republicca piazza metro stop, a very convenient location to the open air sightseeing buses as well. Breakfast was nice. The staff could not have been more helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hotel”
Reviews.Author: philswib
Reviews.Content: Mascagni was the perfect choice for us.. we were there for four nights and the staff was amazing, really helpful whenever we had any questions or problems. Guisseppi at the front desk especially is awesome. The hotel is a few steps away from a Metro station and we took that all over Rome while we were in the city. The hotel had a great breakfast buffet every day. Rooms are small but nice, and we didn't spend much time in there anyway. I would definitely recommend Mascagni to anyone looking for a nice, reasonably priced hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Boutique Hotel within walking distance to everything in Rome!!”
Reviews.Author: jacygem
Reviews.Content: This is truly a gem of a boutique hotel in Rome. The staff, room, service and breakfast were first class all the way. The hotel is situated close to all the sites and within walking distance to everything we wanted to see on our first trip to Rome. We are grateful to our travel agent for booking this magnificent hotel for us and would most definitely go back to Hotel Mascagni again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for holiday in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MartinRE
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at Hotel Mascagni and it was excellent in every respect. We would happily stay there again without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Service, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Mark3501
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mascagni is a great value. Exceptionally clean, comfortable. Good location. 8 Euro cab ride to Vatican City. Close to major attractions. Rooms were well appointed, large, and very good temperature control even during the heat of August. All of the staff were friendly, helpful, and courteous. This is an excellent choice for a leisure trip to Rome. The front desk also provided recommendations for excellent dining within a few blocks of the hotel. You will not be disappointed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “amazing and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: cat7607
Reviews.Content: We have booked directly through their web-site:the location was perfect,the room was clean and the staff,expecially Stefano,,was helpful! Perfect Hotel and good breakfast:we'll be back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, straightforward.”
Reviews.Author: MKC27
Reviews.Content: I stayed here just one night on short notice. I can't say whether it is good value for money as I'm not too familiar with Rome. But I found the service very good. I arrived late at around 2 am and found the front desk waiting for me. Check-in and out the next morning was minimum hassle. The rooms are small but given the old buildings in the area, to be expected. I was a single traveler so this might be a bigger issue if you are traveling with a family. I would come back here. I found it clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Bad choice - I'm sorry I believed all the reviews.”
Reviews.Author: celestep
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Mascagni, from Aug. 12 to Aug. 16, 2010. What a disappointment. We booked this hotel directly through the Hotel Mascagni website. We had high expectations for both the staff and rooms. We normally book with 5 star hotels only, especially in Europe, but the glowing reviews on TripAdvisor made us choose Hotel Mascagni over other hotels in Rome. The only reason why I would recommend this place to anyone is because of its location, but there are so many hotels in the same area that even this is not a good enough reason to stay here. My family of 5 (2 adults, 2 teens, 1 young child) stayed in #406, the family room. We were under the impression that this was a suite, as most "family rooms" we've booked in Europe have been. It was actually very small, with space for just one king bed and a sofa bed, practically touching each other. The "in-room dining area" is about 18 by 24 inches of a vanity mirror in between the closet space. Once we were situated, we found the room to be dirty. There were toenail clippings on the floor, among other things. The shower is poorly designed. For a "four star" hotel and an average of 240 Euros a night, the least we could have asked for was a clean room. Coming from a 5 star in Barcelona, we were quite shocked with the service and the cleanliness of this hotel. Not only were the rooms dirty, but my family was offended by the reception staff. We left for a day trip to Pisa, and one of the staff members asked more than one member of my family if we were leaving without checking out as we were walking out the door. I'm sure they do not ask all of their guests this when they leave for sightseeing. It made us feel uncomfortable, as though they did not trust us to stay at their hotel. When we returned, another staff member rudely asked if we were staying at this hotel, even after having given us the keys to our room. He then proceeded to demand our "documents" and proof of our stay from across the room, in front of a full lobby and other hotel guests. We had already been checked in for 3 days, and we had pre-paid in full! Not only is this inconsiderate, but it was embarrassing for my family. We do not understand why we were treated this way. As for the concierge, I've never heard a concierge say "I don't know" as they do at Hotel Mascagni. We had dinner where they recommended and did a tour as they recommended; both were poor experiences. In our frustration, we decided to forego the concierge's supposed expertise and had our final dinner in Rome at another hotel nearby-- everyone there, from reception to the servers, was personable and knowledgeable in contrast to those at Hotel Mascagni. We left this hotel with disappointment and regret over our choice for our short stay in Rome. Our experiences here were enough to have a negative impact on our vacation. It is difficult to sleep well and enjoy yourself when you do not feel welcome or secure. As a business owner with TripAdvisor listings, I know the impact one unhappy customer can have on potential business, but this review is not an exaggeration. I hope Hotel Mascagni does not treat all its guests the way they treated my family. If I could plan this trip over again, I would have chosen a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If booking on-line, check details.”
Reviews.Author: jul222
Reviews.Content: We booked 5 nights for this hotel on the hotels web page. I choose to upgrade to the superior room (an extra E20 per night) as it included wi-fi and the room had a seating area. I also emailed and called the hotel to confirm and to ask for a quiet room at the back of the hotel as I am a light sleeper. On the phone, all arrangements were confirmed. On arrival, we were given a standard room at the front of the hotel. I checked at reception and they told me that I was mistaken and it was a superior room. It was not! No wi-fi, no seating area and very noisy. After much complaining and standing my ground, I was told that there were no superior rooms available either here or at any of their other hotels (what????) and we could change to another room in the morning as the hotel would be quieter. In the morning, we left early to tour the city and when we arrived back were given another room and our belongings had been moved. The room was much better, had a seating area, higher ceilings and wi-fi access, in short, the room I had booked and paid for in the first place. However, the room was still at the front of the hotel and extremely noisy. This experience really spoilt our stay, I hate to be deceived and only want what I paid for. The hotel did not offer a refund for the first night we spent in the standard room. The staff were all polite and helpful, the hotel very clean. We were given a bottle of complementary sparkling wine to help celebrate my partners birthday. The breakfast was adequate and coffee great. The location is good, easy access to trains, buses and metro and walking distance to numerous sites. If it hadn't been for the hotel trying to put us in a cheaper room, I would have awarded this four stars. Be aware of the "con" when booking and take ear plugs for the traffic noise and you will have an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Mascagni - Four Star Hotel At Good Value”
Reviews.Author: HKFoodie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for US$150 p.n. (weekday). Mascagni is a modern hotel around 15 min. walk to Spanish Steps or train station. If you are crazy to have a car in Rome, it is much easier to find a public parking spot around the hotel (Euro 1 per hour, 8 am - 12 midnight) or you can pay Euro 30 in the nearby parking garage. Staff was friendly and helpful. We had a dormer room which required us to walk up some small flights of stairs so I wouldn't suggest this type of room if you have a choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: redsbench5
Reviews.Content: Stayed a couple of nights. Nice staff especially Marco. Very helpful with directions general info. Breakfast worked for us as we are cereal and fruit people. Cab stand right across the street from the hotel which is convenient. Easy walk to Trevi fountain and the Pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel - can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: ElsieGarcia
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at the Mascagni. We had a false start as they had double booked us on the Friday night but they whisked us off to a comparable Hotel (the Imperiale) where we were treated very well. When we checked in on the Saturday Luciano and his wonderful staff could not have done more for us. We were upgraded to a superior room without even asking and they gave us bathrobes and slippers and a large basket of fruit on the bed. After dinner at a great restaurant they recommended and booked us into, we returned to champagne on ice in the room! Our superior room was great with a large bathroom with all mod cons. Air conditioning was efficient and quiet. Breakfast was the usual Italian buffet and was tasty and plentiful with lovely creamy cappuccino served by attentive staff. There's no restaurant in the hotel but they are about to build one. Hopefully we will return to Rome and will definitely stay at this hotel. Close to the Via Nazionale on the right where there are great shops and the Piazza Berberini to the left where they are great cafes and restaurants. Would not hesitate to recommend the Mascagni.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel Close to Rome Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: sydneygirl63
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Mascagni in May this year with my husband and could not have been happier with our choice of hotel. It was easy walking distance from the main train station and all the major sights in Rome. We arrived early in the morning after a long trip from Australia and we were immediately made to feel welcome with a cup of cappuccino in the bar and plenty of suggestions as to what to do until our room was ready. The rooms were nicely decorated and very comfortable. The breakfast was very good with a different interesting Italian speciality cake on offer each day. WIFI was available in the lobby area on each floor although we found that we could access it in the room which was excellent. Would definitely stay again if I am lucky enough to get to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Abz_Has
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the basis of the price/availability and the background of reading the previous reviews. Pros: - Very polite and attentive staff - very close to public transport - Walkable distance to most attractions (if not, hop on/hop off bus stops outside hotel, metro/taxi is a minutes walk away) - In a reasonably busy (but not too busy) area so it was safe for us to walk out at night - Clean, quiet and decent sized rooms - Breakfast was continental-ish but there was a good spread (with scrambled/boiled eggs, sliced meats etc) and I certainly was not bored after 4 days Cons: (small ones fortunately) - Bed was too too firm for our liking but I suppose that is a personal opinion - Poor-ish internet reception in rooms (we had complimentary service) but I wasn't fussed about not having the internet. There were internet pcs outside the breakfast area.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: mariacy
Reviews.Content: I was there in previous summer and staying there was really a very good experience! Rooms are not very big but are comfortable clean and tide! They are very cute and in Rome style! If you not going to stay in the hotel all the time is the best place to stay! Hotel was above our expertise! breakfast was good and personnel was very kind and always willing to help us! I should also mention that location was the best! Very close to Nationalle street(500m) where you could get a bus for everywhere! Ver very close to metro(500 m) and very close to train station (<1km)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location& Staff”
Reviews.Author: jbwardi
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this hotel to us, it was a great place to stay. Location is great for many reasons, you can walk to alot of major locations like the Spanish steps and Trevi fountain, on the other hand you have two major tour bus stops "hop-on, hop-off" just outside the hotel. The tour bus goes around all the major sites and we used it as our mode of transport in the city, it comes out cheaper then a taxi (20euro for 48hr pass). Back to the hotel it self, Mascagni is a nice hotel from the inside, rooms are of nice size and well kept.
