The cleaning lady appeared to live in our closet since every time we left the room we would come back to find she had cleaned it yet again. The people at the reception are extremely friendly and helpful, they are more then willing to help with anything you need, they make the stay even more enjoyable. The only observation i have is that the breakfast is the same everyday, which gets a little boring. To sum up, you have great location ( walking and tour bus stop), great staff, clean cozy room, clean and very safe area and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Best Concierge Service in Rome”
Reviews.Author: fungirlconnecticut
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Rome with our three daughter's in their 20's. We stayed at the Mascagni for 6 nights, our daughter's stayed for 4 nights. We were greeted so pleasantly by Guisseppe when we arrived. He had already settled our first daughter in from her earlier flight. He saw to it that every question and every need we had were handled in the best manner possible. He found us restaurants, that were excellent. He got us reservations at the last minute for meals and always had maps and recommendations for everything. The other conceirge ( please forgive me.. Luciano??) arranged for my daughter and i to get italian haircuts from a fabulous and talented hairdresser at La Femme. what an wonderful experience. The hotel was very nice and the service was EXCELLENT on all fronts.. The breakfast every morning was delicious.. coffee/capaccino was superb. The hotel is walking s=distance to the termini train station. this can be a plus or a minus depending what you want to see and how far you want to walk. we walked everywhere... it will keep the weight off from all the delicious pasta you will be eating. would definetly recommend this hotel and would stay there again....

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DocWhoTravels
Reviews.Content: Hi, This hotel is located close to Roma Termini (Cetral Rome Train Station), which is a 15 minute walk to Trevi Fountain. While booking, we thought it wasn't close enough to the attraction but we later found out that it was nice to walk along the streets to get to the attractions. Its also close to Metro stations so commuting isn't a problem The rooms were quite nice, very clean, the staff was very friendly and full of helpful tips. We really enjoyed the breakfast which was nice enough without being lavish. If I had to find something to criticize, it would be the views, but then one doesnt spend much time in the room in Rome. As an added tip, dont be put off travelling to Rome in January. Although its not the summer and a bit drizzly, there were no lines at any of the attractions. We walked in everywhere without having to wait for anything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location...would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: GFD1
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, the room was really modern and had all facilities expected of a 4*. The breakfast was really nice, typical continental breakfast with gorgeous pastries and croissants to finish off. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. We would definately recommend and stay again should the chance to visit Rome occur. It was in a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, small hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel110
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about it but wished it was closer to the Spanish Steps. Front desk was very helpful, breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Be ready for 2* service!”
Reviews.Author: Tesoro_SS
Reviews.Content: If you are staying at a 4* hotel in center of Rome, you expect respective service and attitude, but this is totally not the case for Mascagni. Since I was travelling in March, which is a low season in Italy, hotel was half empty and was selling rooms with nice discount. However the manager at the reception considered his "honor" to remind me every morning and evening in exchange for my requests or complaints that i got a perfect price and usually people pay more for this room and used to show me each time what is the usual price. Guys, if u sell at this price - shut up and provide service, and do not complain u sold it for less! First morning - around 11 am I was in my room when a cleaning lady without any knocking simply entered my room!!! I have never seen that at any hotel, even 3 star, in any country of the world! I left at around 11.30 am, but when I came back around 7 - my room was still not cleaned! when i complained - the manager said that I was in my room and they could not clean!!! though he saw me leaving at 11.30!!! Then, wi-fi and computer use were indicated as free at the hotel. When I asked for login and pass to access, the reception issued me the login and pass, yet the price was indicated as 15 euro. They did not charge me, but the traditional phrase from manager "you pay lower price than usual and your internet is still free!" was of course included into our conversation. Also first day I was a bit surprised to see 2 twin beds in my room as I put a request for one king size bed. The guy who hepled me with the suitcases asked to wait one minute for him to go to reception and check what he could do. Well, that minute was 30 minutes - because I left in 30 minutes and the guy still did not show up!!!! The blankets in the room were dirty, and I merely enjoyed some previous guests' hair on them!!! Fantastic about this hotel were also the construction works that they started every morning at 9 am BUT finished at 11-12 in the morning... Considering that in Italy you only go out in the vening around 9 pm - and come back not earlier than 12 or 1 oclock, and respectively want to have some rest in the morning - it was unbearable to wake up to this noise!!!!! The rooms overlooking the street are especially the ones to avoid - there's a road leading to the square and it gets extremely noisy already at 7 am, and windows hide nothing of this noise. I can go on for dozens of more "details" like above, but to cut it short - there are much nicer hotels for better money in Rome, and being located close to the Termini station and metro is in no way the compensation for one of the worst services I experienced in my life.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, affordable hotel recommended for sightseers”
Reviews.Author: MrR0bin
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hotel Mascagni was very pleasant and enjoyable. The staff were friendly and helpful, the bedrooms and dining areas were clean, the breakfast was pretty decent and the location was ideal for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, Excellent Value, Discount Available”
Reviews.Author: andiero
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent value and they seem hungry for business based on their rates...I'm giving it 5 stars because the price was so resonable. The location is close to the train station (great!) and is mid-distance from many of Rome's sites. My friend and I walked to everything... but a couple of the sites will require you to walk 45 minutes or more. The Colliseum (10-15 minutes walk) is the closest site to the hotel followed by the Pantheon area (20-25 minutes walk); If you're not a big walker, you will want to take a taxi or bus to some of the locations (for those who only want to walk 10 to 15 minutes everywhere try finding a hotel near the Panetheon (that seems pretty centrally located). The hotel's lobby is not going to wow you (it's tiny compared to other hotels its size) and has no restaurant -- while there is a bar on the second floor, I only saw some hotel employees spending time there. Breakfast (also on the second floor) was the best we had while in Italy and included hard-boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, salami, ham, yogurt, granola, cereal, fresh fruit, pastries and -- we counted -- about 40+ items to choose from. The staff was friendly and immeditately asked whether we wanted cappuccino or coffee or tea. We got 15% off of the rooms for visiting during the off-season and then we got an upgrade to what I hear is their nicest room (601) for 20 Euros (normally 40 euros) (so we payed 120 Euros per night for four nights in what I believe is their best room (I overheard someone on staff say that)). The room 601 was in the back of the top floor overlooking some other buildings and a cool dome-like structure -- it was very quiet. Our room had a couch area (nice). The bathroom shower has one of those partial swivel-glass doors that seems common in Italy and so water would get on the floor (but this seems common in Italy (at least on our trip)). My only complaint about the room was that it was a bit warm and had a very slight smell of a smoker (the smell of smoke was closer to the room's front door and so it didn't bother us in bed)...we ended up sleeping with the windows open because we couldn't figure out how to get the air conditioning to work. Wi-Fi access is available in the rooms (though it was spotty) and also on the second floor. If you don't have a computer, they have two nice iMacs on the second floor. There are a couple of decent restaurants near the hotel but I recommend you venture out to other neighborhoods to find as good food at cheaper prices. The thing that put my review over the top (to 5 stars) was when the front desk guy got us a private taxi to take us to a very early flight and he packed us a to-go breakfast bag of yogurts, fruit, breads, 2 hard boiled eggs and more -- that was a really nice send-off. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to Termini”
Reviews.Author: Siv71
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights. This was our second trip to Rome, and we wanted to stay at another side of the city than we did last time. We were not disappointed. The Mascagni hotel was 5 minutes walk from the Termini, and close to several sites - and a good shoppingdistrict. The staff was always helpful, the room was nice and clean and we had accsess to the internet. The breakfast was 'just' ordinary, and the only that stops us from rate this hotel with full score.

Reviews.Title: “best location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: LetsGoNowOK
Reviews.Content: On our second trip to Rome we chose to stay at the Hotel Mascagni and it was a great decision. The location placed us near the center of Rome and all modes of transportation. The staff was extremely helpful and wanting to please. We arrived before check in and were escorted to the dining area to relax and enjoy a cup of cappuccino, which was expertly prepared. Our upgraded junior suite was immaculate, spacious and comfortable. The breakfast was very substantial. The American Catholic Church is one block away. The hotel gave us great dining suggestions. On our next trip to Rome we will definitely be staying at the Hotel Mascagni.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Mascagni . . . an Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Trish_09
Reviews.Content: I had researched many hotels in Rome and booked this hotel because of the many positive reviews I had read on Trip Advisor and for its location. It is only a 5 to 10-minute walk from Roma Termini, just past Piazza della Repubblica. We felt very safe in the area where this hotel is located. We arrived earlier than check-in time and the concierge gave us a complimentary beverage and newspaper until our room was ready - very thoughtful and welcomed by us after pulling our suitcases from the train station. We had asked for a balcony room upon booking and were very pleased to have received one when we checked in. The concierge spoke good English and were very knowledgeable and helpful in locating and booking a particular tour for us. Our room and bathroom were very clean and the bed nice and firm. We thought our room and the hotel nicely decorated, our room a good size for Europe and we couldn't hear the traffic below us. The air-conditioning worked well as did the satellite tv and in-room safe (mini-bar fridge could have been colder). The lift is small as in other hotels in Europe. There is a very good supermarket approx 10 minutes walk away and double-decker, hop-on-hop off tour bus stops at Piazza della Repubblica and also near Roma Termini. Hotel Mascagni is well located with helpful staff and we would definitely stay here again should we return to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient base for first time visits to Rome”
Reviews.Author: TokyoV
Reviews.Content: Pros: -Great location to visit Rome's main cultural sites. You are near the subway, Termini, a tour organizer's pick-up point and can easily walk to reach different parts of the city. -The room was larger than expected (especially after having stayed at a closet-sized room in Paris!) -Breakfast selection was good. The daily pastries were delicious! -The hotel was nicely decorated with modern artwork -The staff was helpful, efficient and could speak good English Cons: -The hotel has some technical issues with their internet service. Wireless is supposedly available throughout the hotel but did not work from our room on the upper floor (even when standing at the "Wi-Fi Spot" signs in the hallway). We had to sit in the hallways of the lower floors in order to catch the weak signal. I would not recommend you to stay there if you are on business and must have stable internet access in your room throughout your stay. The front desk's response was that wi-fi is not stable as it is provided free of charge... We almost considered subscribing to the St. Regis' wi-fi as the signal was strong enough to reach our room from across the road! -Windows were double-glazed but noise could be an issue due to the busy cobbled road in front of the hotel. Maybe you could request a room facing the quiet side of the building if you are sensitive to noise. -The shower did not drain properly. The pressure was really variable and made taking a shower a challenge on some days. -Bed mattresses were hard and the pillows felt a bit worn and flimsy.

Reviews.Title: “Good outpost for exploration”
Reviews.Author: Jeff_and_family
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two children, 10 and 13. The hotel offered us a room with a large bed (made by pushing together two single beds) and two single beds rolled in for the kids. Although the additional beds made the room a little tight we appreciated the accommodation (some hotels will refuse to do this). A bellman greeted us promptly and took our bags for us since the room wasn't ready yet (we arrived at noon, three hours before normal check-in but they had us in after we returned from lunch). The front desk was staffed with several very efficient men who doubled as concierges. They provided maps of the city with suggestions for meals and sightseeing. All were very helpful, and although I speak enough Italian for travel purposes, they all spoke very good English. Breakfast was served in a very pleasant suite of rooms. Aside from one mistake (putting out a bowl of raw eggs rather than hard-boiled), the staff there was very pleasant, efficient, and professional. The room were well cared for and kept clean. The hotel is steps away from Piazza della Repubblica, which has a Metro stop on the A line. However, it seems to be a more business oriented area and restaurants within walking distance were scarce. We did eat at one good restaurant for lunch for gave up on the area for the rest of our meals. They have free wi-fi access, and offer use of a computer for something like 4 euros an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Would certainly stay again here next time i'm Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Moosey_london
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Mascagni proved to be a stylish hotel in a great location. Near the Piazza Republica, Via Nazionale and a short walk to Via Veneto. The hotel offered a warm welcome from the moment we checked-in. Marco (?) spoke English and Spanish and offered some ideas on what to visit, he is very enthusiastic and helpful. Breakfast was very good, starting with a cappuccino and a selection of pastries, fruit, yoghurts, cold meats etc., and finishing with an expresso coffee served with good humour by the friendly staff. I knew that the rooms wouldn't have been huge, hey this is central Rome and not country side, but my room was spacious, spotlessly clean and the air-conditioning was perfect! The bathroom had all the usual products, likes shampoo, shower gel etc. presented in a very stylish way, and it was spotlessly clean. The hotel is truly only a short walk from the all attractions of Rome, like Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and the Fori Romani and the Colosseum. A short walk away and worth a visit is the restaurant located in the Via Nazionale on the terrace of the Palazzo delle Esposizioni, it's colled Colonna. The entrance by the external side steps (left hand saide of the Palazzo) and then lift to the top floor. Gorgeous decor and fabulous food! Would I recommend the Hotel Mascagni? Certainly yes!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ziskinct
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 2 rooms with our young adult children. The rooms were good sized and luckily the air conditioner worked as it was unseasonably hot. The location was good and Luciano at the desk was very good in directing us and finding restaurants. It is in a business area but it is near the metro and you can walk a mile to the touristy areas.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoMilo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Mascagni for 4 nights. The staff was very helpful and courteous. We were traveling with our 2 teenagers 13 and 17. The hotel upon our request had adjoining rooms for us which worked out great. The rooms were larger than we were expecting after reading so many stories about how all the rooms were very small in Rome. The Hotel was recently remodeled and was very clean and well maintained. The breakfast served each morning had a very good variety. We had a very early tour planned the first day of our stay and the staff even prepared a breakfast for us to take with us since we were leaving before they started serving. The location of the hotel was very good and was within walking distance of most attractions. After all the reseach we had done and stories we read on trip advisor I think we made a great choice staying here. Our son or daughter never once complained about the accommodations which to me says it all.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Great Service.”
Reviews.Author: suemelk
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Close to railway station, sights and Metro stop. Excellent professional staff offered dining and sightseeing advice and reservations. If you are unfamiliar with Rome they are a great resource. Breakfast was fine, room was attractive, clean, comfortable and spacious. Nice bathroom with tub.

Reviews.Title: “a shoe box hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aceq
Reviews.Content: It tries to be a lovely hotel. If nothing else their reception desk people are great. Luciano's smile is always shining and he is eager to help with whatever you need. Here my positive experience with this hotel kinda stops. I call this a 'shoe box hotel' because this is how I felt being there. All spaces are so small, you sometimes need to lean against a wall to let another person pass by. Room is actually fine, but nothing special to write home about. The other reviewers are right - the bed is stiff. Worse, though, (for me) was that the pillow was very thin. Bathroom is very small. The worst about the bathroom is the shower. I already said once in my reviews that a proper working shower for me is half victory for the hotel. The shower in my room was a shock therapy. I can't figure out why, but the temperature of the water goes in a cycle from very hot to refreshingly cold. I figured out this cycle and dived in at moments when the temperature was tolerable. We reported this to the staff and in the evening the water flow was stronger, however the temperature cycle remained there. On top of that because the bathroom is small, they tried to fit everything in there, so after you take a shower, your whole bathroom is completely soaked (and I am talking about a 5min shower - you cannot take more than that with this shock therapy). Gladly they have an adequate supply of towels to throw on the floor. Other issues are: - wifi does not work properly in the hotel. There is only one spot where you can get a fair signal. They don't charge for wifi because of the signal issue. I was warned that the signal can go off any moment, but then it would come back. - breakfast is simply poor. The selection of cold cuts was shrinking by day. In our first breakfast they had mortadella, pancetta, turkey ham and cheese. On the second day mortadella was missing. On the third day pancetta disappeared. So we went outside for a breakfast because the choice was really bad. Always cold cooked eggs, cheap orange juice concentrate (very sweet), train-quality coffee... the bottom line - they should work on breakfast. Charge me more, but give me a good selection and fair Italian quality. Here is an example that gives good description: on the second day I saw a waiter standing over a bowl of cereal flakes with a spoon and he was going through the flakes as if looking for something. I wouldn't eat cereal in this hotel. Good - location. Although I'd prefer to be closer to piazza venezia, but I admit the room prices most likely are steeper there. You can pretty much walk to most great places in Rome (aside from Trastevere, perhaps). Bottom line - if you have a good deal (eur 100-150/night), perhaps it's a good compromise (after all most go to Rome to walk the streets and not sit in a hotel room). But if you are paying EUR200 and more, find yourself another hotel. Let it be a bit further away, but at least you'll get what you paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Walsher69
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Mascagni is a great hotel in a great location, situated just of Republica and Via Nazionale. The Republica metro is literally 100 metres from the hotel. The hotel itself is spotlessly clean and the buffet breakfast is very good. They offer a selection of pastries, fruit, yoghurts, cold meats, eggs (scrambles and hard boiled), bread rolls, tea, coffee and juices. The room we stayed in was small but very adequate. As it was very hot the air conditioning was very welcome when we returned to the room. The bathroom was restocked with shampoo, shower gel etc every day. The staff in the hotel was very very friendly and helpful. Particular mention should go to Andrea who worked nights when we were there. He was extremely helpful and advised us on the best places to go for restaurants, bars, shops and sights. The Trevi Fountain is a short walk (15 mins max) from the hotel. The Forum and Colosseum are also very close (20 to 25 min walk max). You could always use the Metro but we walked everywhere as there was so much to see. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anybody travelling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel with great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoJerry1379
Reviews.Content: If you want a nice hotel in Rome with a decent location and affordable price this is the place for you. The hotel has great access to the metro (perfect for getting around Rome quickly for 1 euro per person) and is within 10 minutes of the train station. It is within a moderate walking distance to most of the sites. While other hotels may get your closer to the sites and center of rome this place was a great deals and had very nice, clean. recently renovated bathrooms and bedrooms. Free wifi, computers, and a good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Poppy1
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned about chosing a hotel in Rome as read so many bad reviews but the Mascagni was wonderful. The staff could not have been more helpful in particular the gentleman on the desk in the evenings (so sorry cannot remember his name). On arrival we were given a choice of two rooms both lovely but decided to go for the one with a little balcony. The room was very clean, nicely decorated with a large comfy king bed. The breakast buffet very good and consisted of a variety of fresh and preserved fruit, two types of cereal (a granola and corn flakes), and assortment of sweet pastries, rolls with butter, preserves, cheese and some cold cuts. plus fresh orange juice. The Hotel was very central for most attractions to walk to and the Metro very close by. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants an enjoyable stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for tourists !!!”
Reviews.Author: oberontitania
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel very clean. The position is perfect. The room are not very big I have to admit. We had room n 302 which was close to the service room and was very noisy. I think the problem was only of this kind of rooms though. The staff is very kind!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!!! Really amazing!”
Reviews.Author: mihand
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel, the rooms are big, clean and nice, helpful people and such a good breakfast! I have advised all my friends to go there and I would definitely recommend it to anyone going to Rome. It's simple, for me, if it's Rome, it's Mascagni Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A Holiday to remember for the next 25 years!”
Reviews.Author: zoeanderin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I meet in Rome and decided to return to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary with our 3 children (all young adults). We had a ball. We saw Ireland win the Rugby International, loved our hotel it was really central and threw a coin in the Trevi Fountain in the hope that we might return again someday. Five of us stayed for 4 days and my husband and I stayed on for another 6. Rome is a beautiful city and we found all the staff at the Mascagni very helpful and friendly. On the whole their English was excellent which made it much easier for us because non of us are linguists! I can highly recommend the Mascagni.

Reviews.Title: “They were fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: MAFIA81977
Reviews.Content: If it wasn’t for the Mascagni Hotel our whole trip would be a disaster since our luggage were lost for the 2 out of 4 day staying in Rome. They were fantastic!! They were so helpful and kind and had all the good qualities you expect from any hotel staff. The hotel and rooms itself was the cleanest I’ve ever been to, and I am very picky, and it was the first hotel ever that did not smell like a hotel!!! Unbelievable!!! Plus it was just 5 min walking from Termini station, 1 min from closest metro station, and 7min to piazza Barberini, 20min to Colosseum, 40min to Vatican, 15 to Trevi Fountain, 15 to Spanish steps…. In other words, We only had to take the metro to the Vatican but we still walked back. Great spot!!! Thank you so much Mascagni!!! We had a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: BuccaneerDave
Reviews.Content: Our stay was perfect! The location worked out very well for us. Very close to Station Termini and just up from the Republicca underground station. We walked to all the major sights including the Vatican from here. We stayed in room 601 for 3 nights and received an excellent deal. Top floor at the back of the building. The room was excellent. Super clean, quiet and very well laid out. The hide-a-bed was the best one we have ever seen before. Our son loved sleeping on it. The bathroom was attractive with a great layout and all the right amenities. The selection of tea and coffee was great. But the two best things were the breakfast and staff. The breakfast had a great selection and was fresh and relatively well stocked at all times. The fresh coffee was excellent. Each day we tried a different selection of items and had a great breakfast. The 3 gentlemen at the front desk really took our stay from great to excellent. The provided us with knowledgeable answers to our questions and had a very firm, professional grasp of all the things to see and do that would work well for our family. We took all three of their restaurant suggestions and all were excellent. Two of their suggestions were some of the best meals we have ever had (La Matriciana, our favourite by far, and La Pentolaccia). They even suggested a concert of Opera Arias that we would not have been aware of, nor would have looked for and it was the highlight of our stay. All in all this hotel enriched our experience in Rome and we would not even consider staying again in exactly the same room.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mascagni!”
Reviews.Author: ronniebrigantine
Reviews.Content: My husband and I searched many hotels online and decided on the Mascagni. What a great decision. The staff was excellent, very helpful and the location is perfect. Very central to everything you can take the subway, buses or trains with just a short walk. The room was beautiful! You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: cblanchard223
Reviews.Content: The Masgagni has the best service avaialble. The front desk people were fantastic with giving directions, suggesting resturants and anything else you can think of. They even loaned us an unbrella when it unexpectantly rained for a day and a half. I would reccomend this hotel for sure to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Central and helpful”
Reviews.Author: penguinIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four nights during the month of August. We had a seven month baby with us. The hotel is very central to everything you want to do in Rome. You can walk almost everywhere. We took the underground to the Vatican and the colosseum. Althought you could easily walk to the Colosseum. You can buy a daily ticket for €4 or a one trip ticket for €1. Either way,it's great value. The hotel itself was clean. The staff were all friendly, apart from the barman, who was always looking for tips. He always had a sad story that it was hard to feed a family. That he worked so much doing everything, but people don't tip him. This really got on my nerves. We asked for a kettle of water to make the baby's bottles, and you'd think we asked for something huge. We actually went out the next day and bought a kettle. It was easier than dealing with all that again. The staff in reception were noth friendly and helpful. They gave us a map when we arrived and gave us general info on Rome. They were always more than willing to help with anything. The breakfast consisted of cerals, fruit, cheese, cold meats, variety of bread ( chocolate crossants were fab.) boiled eggs, yogurts,tea and coffee. Staff were also very nice, but spoke very little english. Our only complaint was the air-conditioning. Although it was better than nothing, it worked just about. We really enjoyed our stay here and would return. The hotel is within walking distance of Termini station. Don't be caught by the taxis. €10 is the max you should pay if you really want to get one. Otherwise it's only across the square.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous all around - Front Desk, Housekeeping and location”
Reviews.Author: Bella_Cara
Reviews.Content: I reserved this hotel through my travel agent who worked with JDB -and clearly this means one thing _ Great price, VIP treatment upon check-in. The front desk staff suggested a restaurant around the corner "Target" which was the polar opposite of what Americans think of when you say " Target"- ]the front desk staff are exceptional. Loved the room that accommdated our family of 4....

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: joevisma
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, wonderful room - clean, comfortable & relaxing. Friendly staff and great breakfast. Well located. We are recommending the hotel to all of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: MerchantNavigator
Reviews.Content: After researching reviews for 4 star hotels in Rome, we found the Mascagni had the best reviews. My husband and I stayed for 7 days with our 3-year old son in Room 507. My father in law was in room 505. The service was excellent and always delivered with a smile. The staff loved having a little one around. The room size and bed were quite typical of any hotel you will find anywhere in Europe...small room, firm bed with flat pillows. The staff will gladly supply extra pillows. The bathroom is also typical of European bathrooms that you may not be accustomed to. The bath faucets have a hose that will help you prevent a flood on the bathroom floor. They do not use shower curtains and the glass partition is not enough to keep the water in the tub. So we were sure to shower in the mornings before the cleaning crew came to clean up the small lake on the floor. Even if you have a room facing the street, with the window closed, you won't hear a sound outside...very quiet. Francesco at the bar was very pleasant. While at the bar, we met a couple from Australia who visits Rome regularly and this was their 18th stay at the Mascagni Hotel!!! They said they love the service, and it felt like home away from home. The taxi stand is just across the street, the ATM is just a few stores down, the metro is just a few steps further. The location is very convenient to transportation including the main train station, Termini. The hotel staff made an excellent restaurant recommendation (La Matriciana). If you decide to take the tour on the double decker bus, buy your ticket on the bus. We bought ours through the hotel and found out it was 3 Euros more because they have to get their cut. We really enjoyed the hotel, and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mascagni”
Reviews.Author: ckeye
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights and were so glad that we chose this beautiful hotel. The location is within walking distance (5 minutes) from Termini station and close enough to walk to most of the many sights of Rome. The staff were wonderful, especially Michael who was so helpful in finding and booking restaurants for us. The rooms were very clean and classically designed. At breakfast there was a good choice of pastries, fruit and cereals, meats and cheeses and the breakfast waitor was great, so attentive and offering to make us speciality coffees. We would definitely stay here again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel, brilliant city”
Reviews.Author: jsteadReading
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is an ideal location for a quiet/romantic get away. I went with my girlfriend for 3 nights and found the hotel and its location perfect. The rooms are on the small side, but that's common in Rome. They are well decorated and kept well clean. The bed was nice and big and the t.v provided enough entertainment when required (although only one English channel, but showed plenty of football and music, so no english required). The breakfast was nice enough, with a good selection of foods. The bar is also very pleasant and the service was excellent. Location is good, but be prepared to walk to the main attractions. Taxis are always available right across the street if you don't want to walk, and they are relativly cheap. But walking is best as it lets you get a real feel for the city. All in all an excellent stay at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: DylantheCat
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a break for my 30th b'day. The hotel is spotless. Bright and superbly located for the metro and tourist spots. The staff are very helpful and the selection at breakfast was superb. Our room was small, but how big do you want your room to be when on holiday. The hotel has recently been redecorated and it looked wonderful. We will use it again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “not even 2 star”
Reviews.Author: dfalato02
Reviews.Content: ok I know the rooms in Europe are small and hotels are expensive but throughout our trip we have been staying at some phat hotels in the $300-$400 EUROS range...so like $500.00 a night. All 3 traveling with me all agree this hotel was the worst. My dorm room in College was bigger. They try on the service, but no one really gets it. The location Is somewhat central, but not really. Hotel Albergi where we stayed when we arrived is better. I hate the feeling of being ripped off at $300.00 Euros a night and I hope you don't make the same mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Terrific”
Reviews.Author: traveling_gal01
Reviews.Content: Great location in Rome. Not far from the train station (easy walk). Hotel staff was very helpful in getting their guests around and familiar with the area. PROS: --Excellent staff --I personally liked the window doors (gave you a great view of the busy street of Rome....and at times I found it interesting just to watch the chaotic traffic). --Tour Guides can be booked through hotel and the Tours pick you up from the hotel as well. --In room safe CONS: --Your safe has a key that you must carry with you at all times. (Women who want to wear a dress and leave their purse in the hotel room will have to still carry this large key around). --External Noise (Now I don't blame the hotel for this...just be understanding that if you stay in Rome, you will hear an ambulance or a police car every 30 minutes to an hour from the room. There are a high number of incidents in Rome.) Something that I really liked about this place was the day I checked out. I had an early flight, so I checked out at about 3:40 am. On my way out, the guy behind the desk gave me his breakfast. I could tell it was his because he had it already wrapped up in a bag for when his shift would end. Now I didn't plan on taking it, but he insisted. It was very nice of him to do so, so I did. But that stuck out in my mind the kind of generosity and customer satisfaction the staff brings. Another thing I wanted to mention is that I didn't book any tours through the hotel (largely due to the fact that family and friends warned me that booking tours through hotels in Rome can cost you -- meaning that the hotel pockets your money and if they set up the tour, you still have to pay for it.) I did, however, find the same company my hotel books the tours with at the train station behind terminal 23. I booked my tours from there, but they still picked me up at the hotel. So if you are worried about such things, you can go straight to the tour guide office. It is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Rome with an exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: AgeWorX
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four days. What can I say the Hotel was amazing and well beyond expectations! The room was clean and decorated nicely. Luciano and Giuseppe at the front desk were incredible...they are fountains or Rome information and helped elevate the great experience me and my wife had on our trip. Need a suggestion on a restaurant, no problem, for the staff and they would go one step further and even make a reservation for you. Breakfast was excellent (just remember for those of us from North America, breakfast in Italy is a little different). As far as location goes, it was quite excellent. You could pretty much walk everywhere...and if walking is an issue for anyone, not to worry most cab/taxi rides averaged 5 Euro or less. The next time I travel to Rome I will definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SLPLiverpool
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in August over my birthday weekend. I booked directly with the hotel on their website and got a good rate. When we checked in we were given the choice of 2 rooms. The rooms are a little small, and the room we chose was on the top floor so it had a sloping roof but we thought it added to the character. The rooms were very clean, well decorated and had a good air con system which is essential in Rome in the summer. Breakfast was lovely too, there was a good choice and it was a nice bright breakfast room. The staff were freindly and helpful but we were suprised to be told that they didn't have an iron or ironing board to lend to guests and that clothes would have to be sent out to be pressed, at a cost. Overall we'd stay again as it was in a great location near the repubblica metro station which takes you to the colosseum, spanish steps, and near to st peters but it was quite a long walk from the pantheon and piazza navona area. There was a taxi rank over the road from the hotel though and you can walk to the hotel from Termini so we had no problems getting around.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: italy10
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome exhausted from our 14 hours on a plane and felt refreshed the minute we walked in the door. The rooms were nice and very clean, breakfast was great and service was spectacular. The concierge Luciano was amazing!!!! I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Was Great!”
Reviews.Author: PattyMA
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a Rome/Barcelona vacation. While we were in Rome, we stayed at the Mascagni. The staff was excellent, the rooms were small but lovely. I have no complaints and I would definitely stay there again. I also thought the location was great for touring as well as close to a lot of great restaurants. I travel a lot for work and for fun and I've stayed at many of hotels and I was very pleased with Mascagni.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: mama1017
Reviews.Content: Staff was excellent..Giuseppe, Luciano and Francesco at the bar. All wonderful, personable and very attentive. The rooms were great; clean, but a little on the warm side. The a/c could use some work. The breakfast buffet was not very appertizing. The eggs were always very wet and runny, and there was not much to choose from. Also, it took a very, very long time to get hot water for tea. Overall an excellent experience and we would stay at a Silvers Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: MaighNuad
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Mascagni last weekend for 3 nights - Great hotel - room was lovely - beds are hard but that suited my back perfectly. Staff are just brilliant - recommended a fantastic restaurant for our first night and we enjoyed it the best of all our meals in Rome. Location is superb you can walk to all attractions with exception of Vatican , it is just a little to far to walk to and you are going to be standing in a que there so you need to save the feet!!!! Breakfast for us was only average - only real downside - guess the Continental Breakfast just does not suit the Irish! in Saying that we did eat every morning and tea and coffee were fab!!!! Would def stay here again if returning to Rome

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: rachaelviola
Reviews.Content: My husband, 10 year old son and myself stayed for 4 nights in January. I cannot fault this hotel at all. Ideally located for shops, attractions, hop on tourist bus (yes I know but we did have our son with us!!). and fabulous restaurants. The concierge, waiters, bar staff, cleaners , everyone we came into contact with are so attentive and helpful, nothing is too much trouble. YES, the lobby is a bit on the small side but who cares, is it not simply a ways and means of getting in and out of the hotel! You don't sleep there do you! The rooms are spotless, bathrooms spacious and considering our room was facing the main street it was considerably quiet. We wouldn't hesitate in staying here again. I'm just sorry I didn't know about the place the first time I came and stayed in a right dump round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: dannafromcalgary
Reviews.Content: This hotel was alright. It is very clean. The hotel lobby is tiny. The internet was never available. We were bumped to another hotel on our third night as the hotel was overbooked. The breakfast was alright - it would have been nice to get some fresh fruit. We did make sandwiches for a snack for during the day. We took day tours with APIAN TOURS - a great suggestion!! They pick you up at the hotel and offer great tours with great guides. The meals on an Appian Tour is above and beyond delicious and way too filling!! Location isn't great for people who like to walk to the tourist sites. It was quite a way out - and of course, we were there during the TAXI strike - so we really did ALL the walking in 100 degree temperatures!!! The water in Rome from the Aqua Duct fountains are totally fine to drink. I live in Canada and would NEVER drink local water - but we were told that it was alright - and it was!! Which was a good thing because the bottles of water there are a fortune to buy!

Reviews.Title: “classy”
Reviews.Author: tomandbridie
Reviews.Content: centrally located lives up to its 4 stars rooms and service superb will visit again

Reviews.Title: “centrally located”
Reviews.Author: zillexamom
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mascagni is centrally located on the Via Vittorio Emmanuale Orlando, near the Piazza de Reppublica. One can walk to all the major attractions, except perhaps the Vatican. My husband and I DID walk back from the Vatican, but we took all afternoon, stopping to visit sites along the way and taking frequent breaks for caffe or gelato. The metro is near the hotel and easy to navigate. I would recommend a private tour of the Vatican and Sistine Chapel with a wonderful agency called Romaround. There is a tour company a few doors from the hotel which I would not recommend. The tour guide and staff were very nice, but so disorganized that our tour was an hour and a half late starting. Our room was large and tastefully decorated with fresh linens and towels everyday. The staff was courteous and went out of their way to accomodate us. I have two criticisms, though...the bed was too, too, hard and the elevator much too small. The buffet breakfast offered was fine with plenty to please everyone, but I did not like the tip tray prominently displayed on the buffet table. The area around the hotel is well lit and we felt quite safe even walking about after midnight. If I were to return to Rome, I would most certainly stay at the Mascagni.

Reviews.Title: “Will not return”
Reviews.Author: syrurs1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for part of our honeymoon. Good things: The room was modern, nicely decorated and well lit. There was a huge wooden armoire in the room. Marble tops on the nightstands. Breakfast was nice and staffed by a cheerful attendant. Close to major attractions, easy to get a cab. Next door is an international book store. Few blocks away is the BEST Italian food we had the whole trip (Ristorante La Pentolaccia). Bad things: The lobby is TINY (barely room for more than 3 people to stand with luggage). One of the front desk clerks was very rude to us and unpleasant. This man also seemed annoyed with me when I wanted to pay to use the internet and asked him to show me how to log on. Regarding our bathroom, the tub/shower was very small to begin with, but there was a swinging glass barrier (instead of a cloth curtain), and it would not stay closed, so water sprayed on to the floor every time we took a shower. Although this was close to the major attractions, we will not stay here again because the front desk staff gave us such a bad attitude. We can easily take our business elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Lost Our Reservation!”
Reviews.Author: Aldo
Reviews.Content: I called in order to make a reservation and they told me the room was available. We than made all the other reservations (flights, trains, tours...all not refundable services). After sending an email to make sure everything was booked properly, the hotel told me they are SOLD OUT! Rome was full at that time and we end upbooking and hotel very far away form the center. This caused problems n order to do the sightseeing tours (they pick up clients only at hotels centrally located). We had topay extra money and spend more time to arrive in town. The hotel replied with a simple email "sorry fully booked. nothing more, not even we apologize or we will help you find another place...They have no idea of what customer service is and they do not care about customers.

Reviews.Title: “small hotel with 5 star service”
Reviews.Author: marleymar
Reviews.Content: Hotel located near Piazza Republica, great location. we walked everywhere. 15 min cab ride to Vatican. Room was small but nicely decorated. Large bathroom with shower. very clean, had cot, sleeper chair and king size bed, fridge, hair dryer, and robes and slippers. My kids thought we were in the wrong room. Coffe pot in room, we also ordered coffee in our room and they brought it on a lovely silver coffee set with nice china. Luciano the Desk Clerk was very nice. Very good english. All the staff spoke excellent english. 90% of the Romans we dealts with in stores, cafes, street vendors spoke excellent english. Breakfast was deluxe continental (eggs) Bread, cheese, meats, cereal, crossiants, fruit juice, coffee. Breakfast was served from 7-10am and when someone got there at 5 to ten they where told it was to late, yet there was an aboundant amount of food . We also had to wait for a table. The dining area is small, yet there are two other adjoing rooms which they refused to let us use, until be just grabbed a plate and sat anyway and others did the same.( I think those two staff members had trouble thinking out of the box. A bit inflexible) To me these was such a minor incident.They have an area with a computer it was $5 for 30minutes which was nice to let everyone know we arrived ok. Also a bar/lounge with a huge plasma tv. No smoking in the hotel. Bar had a very limited menu which we sample all the dishes and enjoyed every bite. Pizza, salad, etc. The guy in the bar was also very nice and we chatted for hours with him. As a special treat for $60 extra you can add a goodie basket (nuts, cookies, chips, )and playstation. They have a limited number of games. It was nice since we don't have one at home and after a long day it kept the kids from fighting. The hotel also has a very small elevator. We took the stairs and the porter took our bags to our room. What ever we needed they took care of. We stayed 8 nights and would stay again and recommend it to all. Great resturants all just a 2-5 minute walk for hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: John1223456
Reviews.Content: Mr. Luigino Rossi, the Front Office Manager was a very helpful person. My wife and I traveled from Zurich down to Rome. This was the best hotel that we stayed at. We had some trouble with a tour operator and Mr. Rossi intervened as much as possible. The breakfast buffet was very good, the room comfortable and clean and everyone was great. I highly recommend this hotel. Just be careful around the coliseum for pick pockets.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Itravelforfun
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, clean, friendly hotel in a decent location. It is on a busy street, but being near the train station it has quick access to bus tours and transportation. The subway stop is one block away. For our family of 4 we found that cab transportation was cheap and quick, only about $4 Euros to the Colloseum, Forum, or Pantheon vs $1 Euro apiece for the bus or subway. The breakfast was nice, the staff attentive, and the rooms were exceptionally clean. The beds were rock hard as we found everywhere in Italy, which was my only complaint. I would stay here again. We traveled with two school age children and a baby, and found the pullout beds and crib excellent (the pullouts were more comfortable than the regular beds).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We belatedly switched to the Mascagni, after having originally booked the Quattro Fontane, and then seeing the terrible reviews on this site! It cost about £40/night more, but it was well worth it! A four day break, with another couple, we were given adjacent rooms (402 & 404), on the fourth floor. The porter told us that we had quiet rooms, and he was right. Very peaceful, even though we were close to a busy area. The place has obviously been refurbished recently, and to my mind is as good in real life as it is in the pictures you can see on tripadvisor. Very nice. The TV was supposed to have BBC, but that wasn't working, so only CNN was in English - but if you are worried about that with so much to see in Rome, I suggest you stop at home.. Air conditioning went well below 20C, and was quiet enough to leave on overnight if you needed to. If you like it cold - no problem there. Breakfast : Ceral, Juice, Yoghurts, Bread (no toast), Scrambled Egg, Ham & Turkey (processed), Fruit, Coffee - as much as you liked. Bar was a little pricey : 20 Euro for 4 soft drinks, so drink outside the hotel. Rooms were not available until 2pm, but they kept our bags once we arrived at noon, and got maps of the area and 5 minutes on what to see and do. Front desk knew all the metro details and bus numbers to everywhere. We had no problems during our stay, so can't comment on how any issues got handled. I'm pretty quick to spot things I don't like, but I can't fault the place. 10 minutes walk from the Termini - 2 minutes to the Metro station, and despite reports everywhere to the contrary, we found taxis good value too. Hotel to Trastevere area in the evening (15 min) : 7 Euros! Thoroughly enjoyed the trip, and the hotel played it's part!

Reviews.Title: “Well placed Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Strossy
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Mascagni Hotel in March 05 and my 1st visit to the Eternal City i was looking for a quality well situated hotel and i think i found one :-) having based my decision on feedback posted on Trip Advisor. Ifound the veiws pretty accurate, its nicely positioned hotel close to the centre, with the metro and bus stops very conviently placed for touring the city, rooms where of a good size and recently and very tastefully refurbished, bathroom also good size and well planned .the brecfast was modest in varietly but adequate with the breckfast room being rarther small. If you felt enegetic enough the spannish steps are a 20 min walk and colliseum about 25min but bit of a climb back especially after a few glsses of vino or stella ;-) .Definately recommend and would stay there again. Only draw back refurbishment work still in progress hence only 4 stars but sure its all complete by now.

Reviews.Title: “Shambolic Organisation ... Disappointing Solution.”
Reviews.Author: TeeJay321
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay at the Mascagni Hotel as a romantic short stay for my wife and I. The first thing we found out from the man at Reception was that "there has been a big problem". We were then told that we would have to stay at another hotel as the Mascagni was fully booked. No one from Expedia or Hotel Mascagni thought it would be a good idea to let us know about this. We asked to see the manager to work it out. No. The manager was unavailable. We reconsidered as we now just wanted to get on and enjoy our holiday. We asked to use their internet connection to double check the hotel that they were recommending. No. The internet connection was broken (later, the story changed and the passwords to use the internet were locked in the managers office and he didn't have the key ... ). We found our whole experience talking to the man at reception to be very frustrating. He was rude to say the least. Rudeness defined in this case as being an unwillingness to listen to (and to talk over) anything we had to say; an unwillingness to put us in contact with the manager; and an unwillingness even to apologise. He even seemed to joke about it when phoning the other back-up hotel. Excellent. The last thing you want to have to deal with having just landed. When we expressed our displeasure at what had happened. He told us to go away for about two hours and he was sure he could "sort everything out" to our satisfaction. How he was going to do this? I have no clue (either you are fully booked or you are not). Also, he said that the manager would be back by then. We went away based on hope. Though it was difficult to enjoy Rome with the uncertainty of what was going on in mind. Not least, this disrupted our itinerary as we did not plan to come back to the hotel until the evening. So, we came back two hours later. Had the problem been solved? No. Was the manager contactable now? No (and never had been throughout the whole trip). This struck of a lack of professionalism. Why make a problem worse by interrupting our day? Just be honest. We then took the risk (really there was no option) and went to other hotel as suggested. It was a clean hotel, but definitely more of a business setting. So, our romantic holiday in Rome was turned into a business trip. Furthermore, the "upgraded room" they gave us was facing one of the busiest shopping roads in Rome (Via del Tritone). Very noisy, loads of traffic. On the second floor, the hotels so-called "sound-proofing" was next to useless. Given that there were heavy buses stopping at a bus stop outside, we were treated the revving-up/slowing-down of buses late into the night and early in the morning. Peaceful and romantic this was not. Their breakfast left much to be desired. Very dry chocolate croissants, hard bread, and crunchy toast were definitely not the order of the day. So, to conclude, we enjoyed Rome, but regret choosing the Mascagni Hotel. Their organisation appears to be all over the place. The bottom line: You may choose Mascagni Hotel on the basis of their good TripAdvisor reviews (as we did), but will you actually get to stay at the Mascagni? Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay overall”
Reviews.Author: agv0324
Reviews.Content: Overall I'd say this hotel was a 3 and 1/2, slightly above average. The hotel was nice and rooms very clean. The service was great and staff was approachable and friendly. The hotel offered a nice car service for 50 Euro directly the airport. We were loaded with luggage so going back via train, even with the station close by was unappealing. The only drawback was a small bathroom with an open shower (no curtain or glass divider) so much of the bathroom tended to get wet when showering. I don't know if this was just our room. The location was good about a 10 to 15 minute walk to everything except St. Peters. However, a metro stop just around the corner made St. Peters/Vatican a 10-15 minute destination. The breakfast seemed okay but my girlfriend and I preferred to take advantage of the many bars (for coffee and pastries) close by for breakfast. Again, the bathroom was the only drawback and we slightly preferred our stays at Hotel Jolly in Florence and Siena.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel, but not the location”
Reviews.Author: gstern42
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mascagni deserves its four stars, Clean, beautiful room and bathroom. Both large. Our room faced the rear and was quiet. We really appreciated the comfortable bed and the gem of a bathroom. Breakfast was more than adequate. Staff at the desk were ok. But we found other hotel staff more helpful even though we were not hotel guests in those places. Internet use was expensive, although some months earlier I understand it was free. No longer is it free. For a night or two in Rome, the Mascagni may be worthwhile since it is so near the train station, which is a few-minute walk to and from the hotel. We had carry-ons with wheels, so it was an easy walk. But the location, while safe, was not central; and on our next trip to Rome we want to be more centrally located. It took us about 45 minutes walking to get to any of the sights or to areas where we wanted to be. But we found many hotels on charming streets in charming (but busy) areas from which you could reach almost any of the sights within 10 minutes by foot. Many great restaurants to choose from, but not near the Mascagni. Hotel Mascagni staff sent us to an area frequented by only tourists, and the higher-than-normal prices reflected the clientele. Just check a map, find the train station and ask yourself whether you want to be there. The charm of Italy is not in or near the train station. Of course, in a more central location the cost of a room in a four-star hotel would be more than the 190 Euros per night it cost us to stay there. Three-star hotels vary greatly, but with careful selection, you can find a charming three-star hotel more centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Sevice, Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: VeeDee
Reviews.Content: Booked the Hotel Mascagni for 5 nights from November 27 to December 2 based on reviews on this site and we were not dissappointed. Our stay was very enjoyable. The hotel was very clean, and our well appointed room came with little extras like Robes and Slippers in the room and the beds turned down evey night with a bedside mat in place and your slippers placed for you. The bathroom was modern and spotlessly clean. Our room had obviously been recently remodeled, and there was ongoing upgrade work taking place during our stay. This small boutique hotel takes obvious pride in their facility. The Staff was very friendly and helpful, and went out of their way to ensure we enjoyed our stay. The two concierges, Luciano and Giuseppe recommended good restaraunts, and were very helpful with tickets, transportation and advice. Breakfast is included in the room price, and the variety was ample, with fresh fruits, cereals, eggs, cold meats and cheeses along with wonderful rolls and pastries. We only had the opportunity to use the Hotel bar once, but it is quite reasonable. The one tiny elevator is interesting, but did not pose a problem. Two things to keep in mind; ask for a room on the quiet side, and before booking through a third party, try the Hotel Mascagni website. We saved 30 Euros a night by dealing directly with the Hotel Mascagni. I travel to Rome on business several times a year, and my company puts us up in a hotel that considers themselves to be a 5 Star facility. They cannot hold a candle to the friendly, personal service at the Mascagni. The Hotel Mascagni is a definite repeat the next time we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Holiday Guru
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel at the beginning of November. Great location, nearest Metro stop is the "Repubblica" on the Red Line and only a 2 minute walk from the hotel. Handy for visiting the Vatican & Spanish Steps. The Termini Train Station is about a 5/10 minute walk. Staff very friendly & helpful, booked restaurant and evening tour for us. Rooms very comfortable & really clean. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Mascagni - Simply the Best Thank You”
Reviews.Author: normclark12
Reviews.Content: Wow, what an unbelievably superb hotel. We were given a superior room on the 6th floor and my goodness was it worth the money... We had our own stereo cd player which we used to blast out Tina Turner's "Simply the best" which was quite appropriate given the awful room we had whilst in Napoli. The room was brand new, spacious and contained facilities such as your own tea/coffee maker which was much appreciated as we got back to the hotel each evening absolutely knackered from our sight seeing. The breakfast was excellent too with the maitre remembering my preference for caffe latte and my wife's caffe machiato each morning. In terms of location the Hotel Mascagni is perfect as you can walk everywhere with the Metro stop La Republicca only a few minutes walk away making access to the Vatican Museums and St. Peter's very easy. We will definately come back to Rome and the Mascagni Hotel will be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific choice”
Reviews.Author: macabr
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I stayed at the Hotel Mascagni 5 years ago. We had agreed that we would not eat or stay at chain establishments or off-shoots of Americcan properties. Most of the plans for the trip were done by searching the internet. However, the hotel was booked through Delta airlines as we were unsure of the safety of the areas. The choices offered by Delta were down to two; I called and asked the trip advisor which was better. His question: "Would you rather stay at a Best Western or a Hyatt?" The rate was similiar so I picked Hyatt. The advisor suggested the Mascagni. Although I am ambulatory, I have MS so air-conditioning is a necessity. The room was cold enough for my needs. The water water in the shower was hot enough and ample enough to satisfy my daughters who were 23 and 18 at the time. The first morning two of us ordered cappacino, the other tea. On subsequent mornings the cappacinos and tea were brought as soon as we sat. The basket of rolls were wonderful. Much of my planning had been based on recommendations found on the website of the Roman Catholic American parish in Rome (----). Santa Susanna is actually right in that neighborhood as is the church which houses Bernini's "Ecstasy of St Teresa". A short walk in the opposite direction leads to a magnificent basilica designed by Michelangelo. This is actually part of the partially restored Baths of Diocletian. Cabs are readily available because there is a very expensive hotel across the street from the Mascagni. The staff was friendly and the atmosphere so different from hotels at home. I highly recommend the Mascagni.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mascagni”
Reviews.Author: dreamdestinations
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and I am VERY picky about hotel rooms. I will recommend this hotel to my clients. It's a four star hotel, great area for all sites(we walked all over Rome), the rooms were nicely decorated with a European flair, they were really good size for European hotels, our room had a separate small sitting area with a fold out couch, the bathroom was spotless and modern, we had robes and slippers, the bed was firm with crisp linens and four pillows (we like to sleep with lots of pillows), the breakfast was bountiful (fresh breads, eggs, cereals, fresh fruits, fruit juices, yogurts) served in a very pleasant breakfast room, there is a bar but we were so exhausted when we arrived each day from our exploring that we never took advantage of it, the English speaking front desk staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Although it is a small hotel (boutique), my husband and I like the smaller hotels and were delighted with the Hotel Mascagni and will stay there again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mascagni had a great location in Rome. We were only a five minute walk to the termini and just above the subway. We were able to walk to everything that we wanted to see in Rome from the Colosseo to Vatican City. It is a long walk, but if you are up to it, it is great. The staff was nice for the most part, but one of the gentlemen assisting us and answering our questions was a little rude and you could tell he was in it just for the $$. Our travel agent had sent us a pkg and the front desk took the tour brochure out of the pkg and gave it too us before they gave us the pkg hoping we would book a tour through them and not our travel agent. I did feel this was a little inappropriate. I work in the hotel industry and feel that was shady and it should have never been done. On a lighter note, we did enjoy our stay at this hotel and would recommend it to anyone who wants a nice and convienent location in Rome. The continental breakfast was also good.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Hotel Mascagni and were very happy with our choice. The location is very central--convenient to the train station and within walking distance of many sights. The staff is wonderful and the service is superb. The only problem we encountered was that the quad room we booked came with just two single beds and an uncomfortable sofa bed. When I told them that this sleeping arrangement was unacceptable, they immediately added two more single beds to the room. The breakfast buffet is very good, and we enjoyed cappucino every morning. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best showers in Italy!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mascagni for one night in February 2005. This is a very nice hotel--attractive lobby, free internet access, delicious breakfast. Most importantly, the room was great. Comfortable bed, big beautiful bathroom, and an incredible shower with great water pressure (much needed after surviving the "nozzle" showers throughout Italy). We stayed in 4 different hotels in Italy, and this one was the most Americanized in my opinion (due to the bathroom and king bed versus twin beds!).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for summer”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great staff, extremely helpful and friendly, good stay, nice room, after talking to other people in the area think we got best deal for the area. Only drawback, I reckon in winter the colosseum area in rome is the best place to stay as this area far away from nightlife. I reckon summer this would be great 10 minutes from Trevi fountain, areas round there have cheap food however trastevere area over the river more happening if you are under 40. The trastvere area however is a little bit frightening for women on their own, wakable over the river from the area round the mouth of truth. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Good base camp”
Reviews.Author: rm1927
Reviews.Content: Close to transport links mean that you can get anywhere in Rome from this hotel (can even walk to St. Peters - just!). Hotel staff were friendly and our room was nice and quiet. Some facilities not available when we stayed (internet access) but this was a minor negative. A good base for a stay in this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Mascagni”
Reviews.Author: alohamom
Reviews.Content: The Mascagni is a cut above most hotels in its category. The rooms are a bit larger than what you would expect in Europe. Great location for getting around Rome. Many things are within walking distance. What sets the hotel apart from the rest is that the staff goes out of their way to provide you with great service, dinner reservations and arranging for a Papal audience in addition to just plain friendliness in that Italian way that makes you feel special.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel from the 26th of November to the 30th November 04 and we loved it, the only down side was when we arrived they had over booked for the first night, but they did upgrade us to another hotel called the Empire Palace Hotel which is also very nice. The members of staff were really friendly and helpfull, what I like about the hotel is that it had class with the touch of the old. The hotel was really clean and the breafast was nice and fresh. The location of the hotel is great, it's within Walking distance from everything you need to see and from the airport you can catch a train which takes about 30 mintues and then the walk to the hotel is about 10 mintues. I can't wait to visit Rome again, I love the city and the Italians and I will recomend anyone to stay in this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked”
Reviews.Author: classfactory
Reviews.Content: Booked a couple of months in advance using venere.com, but discovered on arrival this week that our booking had been cancelled and that the hotel was fully booked. We hadn't cancelled the reservation, nor had we been notified by email of cancellation for this booking. The manager blamed confusion between the hotel and venere. Reception staff very helpful. We were given a complimentary drink whilst they arranged an alternative hotel for us at the same rate. Within 90 minutes we were on our way in a free taxi to the Hotel Imperiale where we had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Hertzdonut
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with wonderful staff and it has an excellent location near the termini, metro stations, and bus stops. If you want a quick ride home after a night out Roming around, taking a cab to this hotel from anywhere important in Rome is really not all that expensive either.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good location, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not a bad walk from the Termini (main station) if you travel light. There is also a metro station very nearby that can be good for sightseeing (watch your wallet). We stayed 3 nights in October, 2004 and were initially disappointed that upon arrival, we were notified that our reservation (that had been pre-paid months before and confirmed) was not honored the first night (overbooked). However, the staff was very gracious and put us up at a sister hotel (Hotel Beverly Hills) for the first night and moved us back for the other two nights. The room was a nice size and was quiet as it faced the back of the hotel. Special kudos to the concierge staff, especially Luciano, who was extremely helpful when extra care was needed. His recommendation for a restaurant (Tre Moschettieri) was excellent. The staff also nicely accomodated our need for an early breakfast so that we could catch our morning flight back.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Mascagni
HotelInfo.Address: Via Vittorio Emanuele Orlando 90, 00185 Rome, Italy
